loans.name: Filadelfa

texts.en:
Filadelfa is a married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has four grown up children. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for fifteen years. She sells soft drinks, coffee, canned goods, and sugar. Filadelfa wants to expand her business, but lacks the financial resources to do so. 

With a loan, she will be to buy more merchandise to resell, such as soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and canned goods. In the future, Filadelfa would like to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to resell, such as soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 63 years old and married with six children. 

Marcela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marcela requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

Marcela has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marcela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Kisii region, an area known for high banana production. He is married and has 12 children. He loves farming, especially tea and dairy farming. He gets his income from eggs, milk, tea and a few crops. He also has a motorbike, which he uses for a transport service.

David chose Juhudi Kilimo because their lending rates are affordable, and they value their clients. He learned that MFIs (microfinance institutions) are institutions with efficient tools required to help farmers to grow their businesses. This loan will help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Igballe

texts.en:
Igballe is 51 years old and a stay-at-home mother of four children between the ages of 6 and 12 years old. Her husband earns a living transporting goods for several private companies, but they are still very poor and live in very bad conditions in a home that is very old and in desperate need of repair. 

They never had the money to renovate or improve the living conditions, so she is now asking for a loan to replace the doors and windows in order to create better insulation and decrease and eliminate the drafts and cold from entering. She is happy with the opportunity, and knowing that it is a Kiva loan, she appreciates all of the lenders.

loans.use: To replace the doors and windows in order to create better living conditions

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support her family. Marcelina is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marcelina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to resell.

Marcelina has been in this business for 18 years now.

Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is at the age of 48, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fan washing machine, and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical goods as well over at his shop, such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc.
 
He wants to buy new inventories for his shop, but does not have the amount to buy new inventory. Therefore, Rehana has requested a loan from kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can become empowered to buy his desired inventory.
 
Rehana thanks to kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 54 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lydia has a general store business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Lydia has been in this business for 17 years. Lydia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora tiene 52 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta trabajar, está soltera y tiene 2 hijos, actualmente vive en casa de su madre con un hermano quien estudia en la escuela del cantón. 

Dora trabaja como empleada en una empresa empacadora de productos como maíz, frijoles, y otros, también tiene otro trabajo en el cual le ayuda a vender ropa a su hermana, esto le ayuda para comprar sus alimentos, de modo que Dora se dedica a diversas actividades para tener sus  propios ingresos económicos.

El crédito que ella está solicitando, lo necesita para pagar una deuda de su hijo, y así que pueda conseguir un trabajo para que ya no tenga problemas de atrasos con el crédito.

Entre los planes de Dora está seguir trabajando y superarse cada día para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dora is 52 years old; she is an enterprising woman who likes to work; she is single and has two children; she currently lives at her mother's house with a brother who is attending the canton's school.  

Dora is an employee for a packing company that handles products such as corn, beans, and others.  She also has another job helping her sister sell clothing, which helps her buy her food.  So, Dora does different kinds of work to have her own income.  

She needs the loan she is requesting to repay a debt her son owes so he can get work and no longer have problems with being behind on his credit.

Among Dora's plans are to keep working and to better herself every day in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to repay a debt for her son

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria Soledad is 30 years old and has one child, who is in school. She is married.

Maria Soledad is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cattle, vaccines and vitamins.

She has been raising cattle for five years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maria Soledad would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cattle, vaccines and vitamins.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a divorced woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Agueda Senaida

texts.es: Agueda, tiene 28 años de edad, vive  en unión libre con su conyugue, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece a cofradía, Cortes. Anteriormente vendía comidas y hace un años decidió vender ropa usada como ser vestidos, blusas, faldas, short, y ropa para bebe. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Lleva doce ciclos de préstamos con la institución para mantener su negocio tanto de comida como el actual de venta de ropa. El préstamo es por 6,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar ropa como blusas, short, vestidos y ropa para bebe y seguir creciendo. Su plan es obtener ganancias para el sustento familiar.
texts.en: Agueda, 28, lives with her partner. They have three children and live in a village in Cofradía, Cortes. She used to sell food, however after a few years se decided to sell second hand clothes such as dresses, blouses, skirts, shorts and baby clothes. Agueda runs her business from home. She has completed twelve loan cycles with the institution to manage the food stall and her current clothes business. This loan request is for 6,000 Lempiras which will be used to purchase clothes such as blouses, shorts, dresses and baby clothes, to keep her business growing. Agueda's plan is to earn an income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell, such as blouses, shorts, dresses and baby clothes.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Don Roberto, tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en la Lima, Cortes junto a sus hijos. Don Roberto trabajo por varios años en una empresa privada y hace 3 años decidió con su esposa poner un negocio de pulpería donde vender productos de la canasta básica familiar, como ser carnes, embutidos, pan, frijoles, lácteos, refrescos, azúcar, arroz, churros, etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 7,000 lempiras para comprar refrescos, tortillas, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, pan y otros para surtir y vender.  Tiene como meta a futuro comprar un vehículo de trabajo para trasladar los productos que compra ya que se ahorraría de mayor gasto.
texts.en: Roberto is 58 years old; he is married; he has three children; and he lives in Lima, Cortes with his children.  Roberto worked for a private business for several years and three years ago he and his wife decided to start a small grocery store business where they would sell staple products, such as meats, canned goods, bread, beans, dairy, soft drinks, sugar, rice, churros, etc.  The loan he is requesting is for 7,000 lempiras and it is to buy soft drinks, tortillas, sugar, rice, beans, lard, eggs, bread, and other things to stock and sell.  His future goal is to buy a work vehicle to transport the products he buys as that would save him an expense.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, tortillas, sugar, rice, beans, lard, eggs, bras, and other things to stock and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.en:
Asatullo was born in 1982. He is married and has three children. Asatullo is a hardworking man. He lives with his family in a big house. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. Asatullo feeds cows. He also has additional income from growing agricultural products. Asatullo grows wheat. He has 2 hectares of land. 

Asatullo is going to build a new house for his children, as his house has bad conditions. He does not have enough money to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. He is asking for a loan of 5,400 Somoni to buy building materials. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a new house

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur ZOUMANA est né en 1972 à Tiéfala. Père de 5 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle dans le village de Tiéfala (cercle de Bougouni). 
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de boeufs et des moutons de race améliorées depuis plus de 6 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de boeufs. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  3ème prêt maintenant, les 2 prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  4 boeufs. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages de Nièna et Koumantou. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes (revendeurs et bouchers) en Côte d’Ivoire. Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Zoumana was born in 1972 in Tiéfala. He is the father of five children and lives in a traditional family in the village of Tiéfala (district of Bougouni).  He  has been selling quality breeds of cattle and sheep for six years. His experience  has earned him a good business reputation and he receives many orders for cattle. In order to have the necessary resources to meet demand, he collaborates with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his third loan now, having duly repaid two prior loans.

This loan will allow him to buy four heads of cattle. He stocks up in the villages of Nièna and Koumantou. He sells cattle for cash to male customers (resellers and butchers) in  Côte d’Ivoire. With this loan, he plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 75,000 West African francs. This revenue will allow him to pay off the interest on his loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Merinoll

texts.en:
Merinoll is 34 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Merinoll works very hard to provide for them.

Merinoll runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Merinoll has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Merinoll would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of two. She has been running a business selling clothing for many years. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her neighborhood. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Fouzia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale at home.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and gear for her fishing business.

Nila has been in this business for 17 years. Nila earns more income from a general store.

Nila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and gear for her fishing business

loans.name: Rudy Mauricio

texts.es:
Rudy tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y realiza trabajos casuales de comercio de verduras, frutas y otros productos de consumo, tiene 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y aún viven con ellos, por lo tanto solo 3 personas dependen de él.

Rudy se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura, realiza siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol, entre otros productos propios de la agricultura, desde muy pequeño realiza este trabajo y lo aprendió de su padre, también decidió dedicarse a esta actividad debido a que no ha encontrado otro trabajo hasta la fecha, pues la situación de empleo está un poco difícil en nuestro país. También realiza el trabajo de jornal en las temporadas que no está cultivando, lo que más le cuesta es acercar los insumos para la siembra  de los granos los cuales recorre 23 kilómetros en bus para hacerlos llegar, el horario de trabajo del cliente es de 8 horas al día.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar una carreta de madera, herramienta que utiliza para acercar los productos agrícolas hasta su casa, al mismo tiempo con el préstamo pagará el arrendamiento de la parcela donde va a trabajar. 

Rudy desea seguir trabajando muy fuerte en la agricultura y sueña con sembrar muchas parcelas y de esta manera tener productos suficientes para comercializar los granos y satisfacer las necesidades de muchas personas en su comunidad,  que no tienen la oportunidad de cultivar y les hace falta para la alimentación. También sueña con que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales  para que consigan un mejor empleo que él.  Y además pretende ampliar el negocio para el próximo año sembrando dos parcelas más de las que siembra ahora.
texts.en:
29-year-old Rudy studied in school until the ninth grade. He lives with his partner who works doing household chores and occasional trading of vegetables, fruits and other consumer products. They have two young children who live at home with them, so three people are dependent on him.

Rudy works in agriculture, cultivating grains such as corn and beans among other produce. He started working at a young age and learned from his father. He decided to make this work his business, as due to the difficult employment situation in his country he has not been able to find any other job to date. He also does labour work during the seasons when crops do not grow. The hardest thing for him is to obtain the supplies for planting beans and bring them home, as he has to travel 23 km by bus to get them. He works 8 hours each day.

Rudy is requesting this loan to purchase a wooden cart to bring agricultural products to his home, and it will also pay for leasing of the plot of land where he works.

Rudy wants to continue working hard in agriculture and dreams of planting many plots to have enough produce to sell and and meet the needs of people in his community who need supplies. He also dreams that his children will be able to study and become professionals to get a better job than him. He plans to expand his business for the next year, by planting two additional plots than he has now.

loans.use: to purchase a cart to bring agricultural products to his home, and pay for leasing of his plot of land.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 23-year-old single lady who has been working as a hairdresser since seven years ago. She was only 16 years old when she had to quit school and start work experience to help her parents in covering their living needs.

In 2011, Zeinab established her current beauty salon, and she is working hard to develop it as much as she can to keep it the best beauty-making place for her customers.

To keep her salon updated, Zeinab is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to make necessary maintenance to her beauty salon, and make sure to attract new customers through good work and perfect decoration requested to attract new customers' attention.

She hopes that in the future, she will be capable of expanding her workplace and providing working opportunities to many startups who would like to have their own business one day.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to her beauty salon

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pablita is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Pablita has a motorcycle-transport business in the Philippines. Pablita requested a 6,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Pablita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Pablita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab, a 30-year-old married mother of two children, started working as a hairdresser in 2001 from her house, both to help her husband meet their income requirements and to use her time productively.

The steady growth of Zeinab's business through the previous loan, which was invested in buying necessary updated business tools, has led to an improvement in her family's socio-economic situation.

Through her previous loan, Zeinab was supposed to open a separate beauty salon outside her house, but being pregnant and giving birth to a new baby let her make some changes in the plans, and she invested it in buying necessary updated requested tools.

A hardworking woman with a very good reputation, today she is still planning to open her own beauty salon to meet customers' demands, and so is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. 

Zeinab hopes to expand her shop in the future to meet all women's beauty needs.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon to meet customers' demands

loans.name: Megi

texts.en:
Megi is a 23-year-old young woman who lives with her husband in Kutaisi city. The only source of income for this family is Megi's husband's job, working as an artisan and getting 300 GEL (Georgia lari) monthly. As the existing income is not enough for her family to meet all the basic needs, and Megi can’t find the job, she decided to start her own business. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, Megi applied for credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or restart businesses.  A loan of $600 USD will help Megi to purchase stock of used clothing and start a trading business. 

Megi is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person. This credit will be a great support for the family. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate income.

loans.use: To start a business in used clothing

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 53 years old and married with three children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more items like noodles, shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from an Internet cafe.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, shampoo, snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, etc., to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne  41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU  dans La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits alimentaires et des boissons de toutes sortes. 
 Après avoir remboursés correctement le prêt précédent, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. DJENEBA, 2ème femme   de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter  5 casiers de Bière, 7 casiers de boisson soda ''COCACOLA'' et 5 casiers de soda ''FANTA''. 
Elle s’approvisionne à KOUTIALA. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 27 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, de logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group are, on average, 41 years old, have four children, and live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou in the city of  San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through family and neighbors. They sell food and many different types of drinks.  

After having properly reimbursed their previous loan, the women of the Tiessiri group are on their second group loan. Djenba, the second women from right to left in the photo, plans on using her loan to buy five cases of beer, seven cases of Coca Cola, and five cases of Fanta.

They buy their supplies in Koutiala. She sells to a clientele of men and women for cash, and often for credit. She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 27,000 FCFA, which she'll use for expenses related to health, food, clothing, shelter, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy drinks.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is single and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years.

Teresita has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy drinks, CDs, a video player, etc. to boost up both businesses.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a married mother of four children, from Loon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a business selling distilled water for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income.

Teofila is asking for a loan to buy more gallon bottles for her water refilling business. With this, she will be able to improve her business thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more gallon bottles for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.en:
Abduhalil, born in 1947, is married and has adult children. He is a poor farmer who grows crops on 1.5 ha and potatoes on 0.6 ha. Abduhalil, having been busy with this activity for more than 26 years, has great experience. His wife helps him with managing the business. 

When the agricultural season is over, he has been busy operating his taxi service but now his car has broken down. Abduhalil is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to repair his car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair the car used in his taxi service

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion, aged 53, is married with three children: she works very hard to provide for them. Visitacion has run a general store in the Philippines for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, seasonings, sugar, coffee, juice, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

Visitacion has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 54-year-old married mother of one child, who has been working as a tailor for two years. She is the sole breadwinner of her family, since her husband currently does not work.

Fadwa used to work as a nurse, but her older age requires her to have a home based business, which is why she developed her tailoring skills to cover her family's living needs.

Fadwa is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance at her house that has to do with the plumbing and sanitary work, to keep it a healthy place for her family members and to keep it in good shape for the visitors and expected customers.

She hopes to stay in good health and keep on providing her beloved family with the necessary living needs and requests.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance at her house that has to do with the plumbing and sanitary work.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent has been running a profitable grocery business for the past five years in Oloitoktok town. She used her previous loan to purchase onions for resale and has been repaying the loan well. 

Millicent also has a hotel business from which she earns a monthly income of KES 6,000. She will be using this loan to buy a gas cylinder which will enable her to prepare food faster. She plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to pay her children's school fees. 

This is Millicent's fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya: in future, she hopes to own many assets.

loans.use: To buy a gas cylinder.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital (purchasing more cosmetics, jewellery and beads).

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 41-year-old mother of three children. She is a responsible housewife and looks after her family at home. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is very hard working, gracious and honest woman. 

Shazia's husband owns a furniture shop in which he makes different furniture items such as sofas, beds, chairs, iron stands, safe almirahs etc for selling. He has been running this furniture shop for many years and earns a good profit from the business. Now, he wants to establish his business by purchasing new plastic furniture, wood, and some raw materials for making new designs of furniture items. Due to household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the desired items. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, wood and other raw materials for the development of the business. 

Shazia thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support to her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husbands furniture making business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, pepper, dried fish, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman and the mother of two grown up children. She lives with her family in Loon, Bohol, in the Philippines. 

Erlinda has been engaged in a pig-raising business for more than 15 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. In the future, Erlinda hopes of expanding her pig raising business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a new member of BRAC and is taking out her first loan for her husband who drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years using petrol which is very costly nowadays. Due to the increase in the cost of petrol, he wants to convert his auto rickshaw to run on liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) but his rickshaw does not have a compressed natural gas (CNG) kit.

Therefore, Nagina contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for the loan amount that is needed so her husband can buy a CNG kit for his auto rickshaw. He will then be able to minimize the fuel expenses and increase his income.

Nagina seems very happy after taking out this loan and says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a CNG kit for her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is a married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She is a basket weaver and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Nonita is asking for a loan to buy materials like buri or native palm, straw and wicker for basket weaving. With these materials, she will be able to weave more baskets thus increasing the number of her products to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy materials like buri or native palm, straw and wicker for basket weaving

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 44-year-old married woman from the village of Giorgitsminda. She has six members in her family, and the only significant income is from her husband's work, who is a baker at a traditional Georgian bakery. Her parents-in-law get monthly assistance from the local government. 

Marina can't find a stable job and has decided to start her own business. She requested a loan for investing in both an agricultural and trading business. She will purchase stock of clothing and will sell it locally at an increased price. Also, she will be involved in agricultural activities, planting corn and selling it seasonally. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and they will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need. Marina awaits your support.

loans.use: to start trading selling clothing and also planting corn to sell.

loans.name: Sumbula

texts.en:
Sumbula was born in 1975. She is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a doctor. Sumbula is a smart and higher-educated person. She has worked in a hospital for more than 16 years, and has great experience. 

Sumbula uses her salary for buying food items. She has does not have a washing machine and she would one, but she does not have enough savings  to buy a washing machine. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy a washing machine for her household. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her household.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes to add to her current stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi appreciates the help from Kiva and Yehu as her previous loan helped her to buy cooking oil and potatoes for her food stall business, Here again Chizi comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy clothes to sell since she has started a business selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman from Loon, Bohol and a mother of five grown up children. 

Carolina raises pigs and has been in this business for 20 years. She is also a dressmaker. Carolina is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her pig raising business thus augmenting her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is from a poor family, and lives with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures the iron accessories, doors and windows which are usable in houses. He has also been providing door to door services to weld broken accessories. A few days ago his welding plant broke due to overheating and needs to be repaired. He wants to buy raw iron material for manufacturing but he does not have money due to lot of household expenses. 

Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy more raw material for manufacturing. Zarina thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw iron materials for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is 23 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his eight siblings and his parents. 

Shadi is studying for his Bachelors majoring in Physics. He is in his fourth year and is only one step away from graduation. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation and to earn better income in order to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he wasn't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Teofredo

texts.en:
Teofredo earns a living through his pig raising business. He is married and has two children. 

Teofredo plans of expanding his business but lacks the capital to do so. So, he has requested a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. Through this, he will be able to improve his pig raising business thus improving his income and profit. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of two sons and one daughter. She is a hard-working and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. Shehnaz has been doing this for many years. She has very good knowledge of the stitching techniques. She sews leather bags for the nearest factory: her husband brings the raw material from the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her to continue operating her business, Shehnaz has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine (juki machine) because her previous machine has become out of order due to continuous work. She thanks Kiva and Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine (juki machine).

loans.name: Gadafi

texts.en:
Gadafi is 24 years old and is single. He owns a retail shop in Mutukula, which he started in 2006, and works for 7 hours every day.

He also does both crop farming and cattle keeping, which he started in order to supplement his income and due to the fact that he had experience in farming. He usually supplies his goods to fellow retailers and local people around Mutukula. 

Gadafi hopes to use the loan to stock more goods for the shop and to buy produce for his farm. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital and also price fluctuations plus the high taxes charged on the goods across the border. 

Gadafi is described as a hard working and honest man and appreciates the work done by Ugafode micro finance limited.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his retail shop.

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
These members are part of "Discipline Group" with five members, and are beginning their second loan cycle with ID-Ghana. They are into the sale of soft drinks, groceries, slippers, rice, beans, yam, noodles, cups and bowls.
 
They are represented by Eunice who is taking her second loan from Kiva. She is a 32-year-old single mother of two, and has been selling groceries for eight years. The loan will be of benefit to the micro businesses of this group and also Eunice's. The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital (purchasing more noodles, rice, beans, sugar, bread etc.), which she will acquire from distributors in the city of Accra. This work enables her to generate income to support her family, since she is single. The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,200 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to increase her capital (purchasing more noodles, rice, beans, sugar, bread etc.).

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, a married woman with two young children, is from Panglao, Bohol. She has been in the pig raising business for almost one year. This is the source of her income.

Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve her pig raising business thus augmenting her income. Mary Jane hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the Kitale area of North Rift, Kenya with his wife and one-year-old child. He has been farming for six years with his primary income source coming from the sale of milk, eggs and mixed crops. Moses also provides transportation with his motorbike. He enjoys dairy farming the most: the diseases that affect his crops and livestock are his biggest challenge.

Moses wants to improve his farming activities by purchasing poultry: he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer short-term loans. This loan will enable him to meet his family's needs and prepare for a very stable future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose operates a restaurant business and she's happy with the outcome. She is again requesting a loan of Kshs 25,000 to buy food items like beans, rice and wheat flour for her business. Rose appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy food items like beans, rice and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Maleika

texts.en:
Maleika is 49 years old and lives in the village of Kesalo. She lives alone and runs an agricultural activity. She works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and potatoes. She always has high quality products which are sold to local retailers for a good price. 

As she has only seasonal income, Maleika decided to start a trading business and seek credit, but her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 600 GEL for purchasing stock of brooms to sell door-to-door.
 
The new business initiative will give Maleika a chance to have financial stability and monthly income. She is grateful for your help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to start a business selling brooms from door to door.

loans.name: Esraa

texts.en:
Esraa is a 19-year-old divorced woman living alone in a sector in Jordan called Marka. 

Esraa is studying for her Diploma majoring in children's education. She is planning to find a job in her field of study after graduation in order to start supporting her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is 23 years old and lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with her eight siblings and her parents. 

She is a university student majoring in law. Noor is in her third year. She is planning to find a job in her field of study after graduation in order to start supporting her family financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 30-year-old married mother of one child, who has been working in selling children's clothes, lingerie and children's medical shoes for ten years. In 2010, she established her current business, to help her husband pay for their living expenses and improve their living conditions. Today, her business is developing properly, and she is working hard to respond to customers' needs and requests.

Mariam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer newly released products, and to pay for the necessary expected baby preparations and needs. She hopes to keep on developing her business especially the medical shoes sector.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer newly released products, and to pay for the necessary expected baby preparations and needs.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida, aged 42, is divorced and has no children. She has a higher degree and is an accountant in an organization. Farida is a smart and hard-working woman who does high quality work in her job. She earns a small salary which is not enough to improve her living conditions. 

Farida is seeking to buy a bed and chairs for her household as she does not have any. She has always wanted to live in a house which provides good living conditions. Farida is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy a bed and chairs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a bed and chairs for her household

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is thankful for the overall support received from Yehu and Kiva. The previous loan helped her to improve her stock of petrol. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy gallons of petrol to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol to sell

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a conservative woman, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. 

Zainab was born in 1965. She is married and a mother of five children. Her daughter who is appearing in the picture is a university student ,majoring in Medical Analysis. She is in her first year and is planning to work in her field of study after graduation in order to support her family financially. Now Zainab is requesting a loan to pay for her daughters' upcoming semester fees as she is facing financial crisis during this period.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Shehab

texts.en:
Shehab is 23 years old. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq with his eight siblings and his parents. 

He is studying for a Bachelors Degree majoring in Accounting. Shehab is in his second year. He is planning to find a better job after his graduation and to earn better income in order to support his family. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he wasn't able to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees for his accounting studies.

loans.name: Al Narjess Group

texts.en:
Mariam is the featured borrower of the Al Narjess Group. She has got together with the other group members to acquire a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Mariam is a 21-year-old single lady, who has had a shop that sells special accessories, cosmetics, bags, and gifts for the past three years. She is the sole breadwinner for four members of her family, which requires much effort to continue to develop her current business to ensure that it earns enough to cover their increasing necessary living needs.

Through her acquired loan, Mariam will increase her business merchandise with special newly released products that will meet her customers' needs and requests, especially for the coming spring and summer seasons. She hopes to continue to expand her business in the future and especially to start wholesale trade if possible.

Mariam is the second from the right in the photo. As for the other group members, Soukna is the first on the left: she is a 28-year-old single lady who is the sole breadwinner for nine members of her family. Rana is the first on the right; she is a 24-year-old single lady who is the sole breadwinner for five members of her family. Fatima is the second from the left; she is a 19-year-old single lady who is the sole breadwinner for four members of her family.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with newly released products that will meet her customers' needs and requests

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a single mother of three children who are of school-going age. They all live in Kitale, an area known for poultry farming. She is a well-established farmer who has been doing it for 20 years with her income sources being milk, eggs, tea and poultry. Violet also has a retail business.‌ In terms of her farming, she enjoys poultry and dairy farming. Diseases are her greatest challenge.
 
Violet joined Juhudi Kilimo because she wanted to improve her farming activities. She says that through this loan, she will be able to educate her children and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 28-year-old woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children go to school in the morning and to a private school in the evening everyday. 
Her husband drives an auto rickshaw and wants to buy an additional rickshaw. He has savings but is still short, which is the reason that Shabana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can be buy the new auto rickshaw. 
She hopes that she will be able to save enough after buying a new auto rickshaw. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat was born in 1979 and is divorced. She is the only breadwinner for two children and works in a state organization. Muhabbat does her job well. Every month, she earns a small salary which is not enough to improve her living conditions. 

Muhabbat is seeking to repair her house as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc.

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en: Ndunge works hard to make both ends meet and she supports her family through the help of her business. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, fruits and melons to sell. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, fruits and melons

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 36-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of three daughters and a son. Her husband owns a fruit shop and participates in paying household expenses. Zainab has requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business in which he likes to sell seasonal fruits. Now he wants to buy bananas in large quantities to sell because the banana season is continuing and the banana price is very low. 

Therefore, Zainab has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy bananas in bulk. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Zainab is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bananas in large quantities for resale.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 54-year-old married woman. She has been living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three daughters and two sons. She is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting her family.

She belongs to a poor family. Her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She had been learning this art in her childhood and now she adopted it for her occupation.

She enabled herself to be independent and earn sufficient income. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a stock of thread, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colours. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Shamshad is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing

loans.name: Maqsoodan

texts.en: Maqsoodan is a 24-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. For six years, Maqsoodan has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Esther operates a greengrocer's stall selling vegetables: she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a vegetable wholesale business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, Esther wants to purchase green vegetables, crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen, age 43, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase baby goats and calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase baby goats and calves..

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 23-year-old single man who has run his special Saj and Lebanese bread bakery since 2013, with four years of experience in this domain.

Hassan is the sole breadwinner for three members of his family, which forces him to put much extra effort into developing his business to ensure that the additional income will cover his family's increasing living needs.

Hassan is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for his business development so he can use it to transport his raw materials as well as transporting his special baked Saj and Lebanese bread to the market.

He hopes that in the future he can open a larger bakery and sell his increasing products in a wider region.

loans.use: To buy a car to transport his raw materials as well as transporting his special baked Saj and Lebanese bread to the market

loans.name: Kimyan

texts.en:
Kimyan is 28 years old, married and has two young children. She lives in the village of Moung Ruessei district, Battambang. Kimyan has farmed rice to earn a living for the last 10 years. She has learned the business from her parents and older people and has gradually improved her farm. Kimyan works hard to provide her children with their basic needs. She is able to generate a daily income of USD10.00 per day.

Now, Kimyan is asking for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household's sanitation practices. Thanks to the special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) for the water loan program, Kimyan is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard her family's health and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en: Muqadas is a 22-year-old married woman. She has been living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting her family. She belongs to a poor family. Her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She had been learning this art in her childhood and now she adopted it for her occupation. She enabled herself to be independent and earn sufficient income. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a stock of thread, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colours. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Muqadas is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 47-year-old married woman. Her husband is a laborer. It was very tough for Naseem to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business selling ready-made garments, as she purchases a variety of clothes in different sizes and colors from the wholesale market and sells in her area. By this time she has attained a good number of customers. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Currently Naseem is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different sizes and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Sibonginkosi

texts.en:
Sibonginkosi is a 23-year-old single young woman from Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. As a committed volunteer in her community, she actively helps keep children in school through life skills development because she believes people have a chance in life when they make informed choices. Sibonginkosi is currently operating a poultry business which she started in 2013 and has been running for eight months. She started the poultry business when she finished school after realizing she needed a stable source of income. 
The Kiva loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. Improving her business will help her increase profits to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: to increase production and boost sales.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, su esposo brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para el mantenimiento de su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children in the District of Cayaltí. Its people are devoted to agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Vilma raises and sells small animals. Her husband provides public transportation services with the use of his own motorcycle taxi. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN in order to buy balanced feed for fattening her animals. Part of the loan will be used to maintain her husband’s vehicle. This will enable them to generate more income for their family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and to pay for the maintenance of her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Dania, es soltera no tiene hijos , vive en casa de sus padres la misma se encuentra ubicada en la Comunidad Arajllanga.
Ella solamente pudo cursar estudios de secundaria, se dedica a la produccion de queso.
Necesita crédito para compra de ganado vacuno, de esa manera podra producri mas queso.
El sueño de Dania  es tener varias lecheras para  poder cumplir con sus obligaciones asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Dania is single and has no children. She lives in her parents' house which is situated in the Arajillanga community. She was only able to complete secondary school and she now dedicates herself to producing cheese.

She needs this loan to buy cattle so that she can in this way produce more cheese.
Dania's dream is to have milking cows so that she can continue to fulfill her obligations and have a better income.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio se dedica al servicio de transporte publico trabaja desde las 7:00 am. hasta las 20:00 pm. 

El vive en casa propia en la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Lucio es comprar repuestos para su movilidad asi mejorar sus ingresos y dar mejorar calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Lucio works in public transport services. He works from 7:00am until 8:00pm. He lives in his own house in the city of La Paz.

His dream is to buy spare parts for his vehicle so he can improve his income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora María mayor de edad, madre soltera con un hijo aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, zona ubicada en el occidente del país,  donde predomina el turismo, y el comercio, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación personal, es  propietaria y administradora de su propio negocio que consiste en compra  venta de mercadería en general como. Ropa nueva y usada, zapatos, cosméticos, medicamentos naturales; también vende fritanga los días fines de semana, elabora y vende mieles, buñuelos, atol duro, arroz de leche, frutas de temporada, y entre otros productos. De manera ambulante, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos a comarcas de este municipio, Dora Maria solicita este crédito para la compra de mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, productos plásticos, y materia prima para la realización de sus deliciosos bocadillos.
texts.en:
Dora María is an adult woman and a single mother with one child under her responsibility. She is originally from the town of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. The predominant industries are tourism and trade.

Dora María is known as an enterprising and hardworking woman who has the drive to succeed on a personal level. She is the owner and manager of a business that involves selling general merchandise such as new and used clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and natural medicines. On the weekends she also sells snacks. Dora prepares and sells honey, fritters, “atol duro” (porridge made from corn), rice pudding, seasonal fruits, and other items. She travels around town as a street vendor to offer these regional products.

Dora María is requesting this loan so that she can buy general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, plastic goods, as well as supplies for preparing her delicious snacks.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, plastic goods, and supplies for preparing snacks.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en: Sabreen was born in 1986. She lives alone in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. For the past two years, she has been supporting herself financially by selling blankets and bed sheets. Now she needs to buy more blankets and bed sheets in order to raise her profits and sales so that she can cover her needs. Because she doesn't have enough money to do so, Sabreen has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and bed sheets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine.

loans.name: Mario Alejandro

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre trabajador y pujante, que lucha incansablemente para brindarle bienestar a su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa de alimentos, desempeñándose como operario de producción y, de manera alterna, se dedica a vender alimentos fritos que él mismo prepara con colaboración de su esposa, estos alimentos los vende en las mañanas, antes de iniciar su jornada laboral y los principales clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo y los estudiantes de una institución educativa que queda cerca a la empresa donde labora; así logra complementar los ingresos para brindarle educación a sus hijos y llevar el sustento a su hogar.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará materia prima al por mayor (verduras, carne, pollo, harina) y cancelará el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, así tendrá la capacidad para aumentar la producción y cumplir con unos encargos especiales que tiene, además de satisfacer la demanda diaria de sus productos, logrando generar mayor nivel de ingresos para solventar los gastos de la familia.
Mario, con su proyección hacia el futuro y las ganas que tiene de progresar, sueña con montar su negocio en un local comercial abierto al público, generar oportunidades de empleo y así garantizar una estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is a hardworking, successful man who fights tirelessly to provide for his family, made up of his wife and two children. 

He currently works as a production operator at a food company. He also sells fried food which he prepares himself with the help of his wife. He sells these products in the morning before starting his work day. In this way, he is able to complement his income to give his children an education and sustain his family.

He will use this loan to buy wholesale ingredients (vegetables, meat, chicken, flour) and to pay off a current loan. He will then be able to increase his production and fulfill some special orders which he has received. He will also be able to satisfy the daily demand for his products and generate a higher income to cover his family's expenses.

With his goals for the future and his desire to make progress, Mario dreams of opening a business at a local commercial property, generating employment opportunities and guaranteeing his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients (vegetables, meat, chicken, flour) and to pay off a current loan.

loans.name: Kasour

texts.en:
Kasour is a 56-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has one cow and two buffaloes, which she uses to sell milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Kasour has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Kasour is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 20-year-old young woman living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. She devotes her time to assisting the elderly in her community who do not have anyone to care for them. Tsitsi is currently renting a stall at a local flea market and selling products such as second hand shirts, t-shirts, pants, skirts, baby clothes and floor polish to the community. She is also operating a small grocery shop where she sells flour, sugar, beans, salt, cooking oil, and women’s sanitary products. She has been able to provide for her family since the start of her business 18 months ago. 

With a Kiva loan, Tsitsi will increase her stock to improve sales. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to further her education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Inayet

texts.en:
Inayet is 52 years old and the mother of two children. She has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 6th loan cycle with Kashf Foundation with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Zaib

texts.en:
Zaib is a 40-year-old woman and is successfully running a small school canteen. She has gained five years of experience in this field and earns enough to meet the needs of the family members. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and education. 

She wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of biscuits, cookies, sweets and beverages to cope with the increasing demand at her canteen. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, cookies, sweets and beverages.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás es un hombre casado de 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus seis hijos ambos viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Don Tomás es un hombre trabajador que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios, como también se dedica a reparar celulares. Eligio esta actividad porque es rentable y productiva. Ahora él puede contribuir con los gastos de su familia ya que en el negocio que tiene le genera buenos ingresos y ganancias.
El ahora cuenta con cuatro años de experiencia, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 8,000.00 para la compra de celulares, audífonos, protectores de celulares, estuches y cargadores.
Su sueño es construirles una casa a sus hijos para que tengan un lugar seguro en donde vivir  y  de esta manera mejorara la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomás, 36, lives with his wife and six children in the department of Sololá.

Tomás is a hardworking man who fights to provide for his family. He makes a living selling cell phones and accessories, as well as repairing cell phones. He chose this business activity because it is profitable and productive. He can now contribute to his family's expenses because his business brings him good earnings and a good profit.

He now has four years of experience. He is applying for a loan of 8,000 quetzals to buy cell phones, headsets, screen protectors, cases, and chargers.

His dream is to build a house for his children so they can have a safe place to live, improving his family's life.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Santos Herminio

texts.es: Santos de 21 años de edad trabaja como auxiliar de construcción, oficio que ha realizado en los últimos dos años. Santos vive con sus padres y tienen su vivienda muy deteriorada como se puede apreciar en la fotografía. Él desea mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus padres. Santos, sabe que el oficio que desempeña le enseñará más y con empeño se capacitará más para la construcción de obras civiles, su sueño es ser un buen maestro de obra de construcción. Por hoy santos desea mejorar su humilde vivienda; por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI y con el dinero comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos, madera, hierro para reparar él mismo las paredes y techo.
texts.en:
Santos is 21 years old and works as a construction assistant. He has been at this job for the past two years. Santos lives with his parents, but their home has greatly deteriorated as shown in the photograph. He wants to improve the living conditions for himself and his parents.

Santos knows that he will continue to learn more on the job as he works on more construction projects. His dream is to become a master builder. For now, Santos wants to make improvements to his modest home. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. The money will be used to buy galvanized sheets, nails, wood, and iron so that he can repair the walls and roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can repair the walls and roof of his house.

loans.name: Elena Rosibel

texts.es:
Elena tiene 54 años de edad, solo estudió hasta cuarto grado pues en aquellos tiempos era difícil la situación económica, actualmente vive solo con su hija de 25 años de edad quien sufre de problemas mentales y Elena es quien cubre todo los gastos en alimentación y medicinas para ella.
Elena se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella lava ropa a otras personas de la ciudad donde ella vive y ademas invierte en productos como lociones y los vende a conocidos, es de estas actividades que ella obtiene ingresos para su familia.
El crédito solicitado lo necesita, para comprar diversidad de lociones para comercializarlos en la zona urbana.
Elena sueña con darle todo lo necesario a su hija y que no le falte nada ya que necesita mucho de su cuidado por sus problemas mentales.
texts.en:
Elena, 54, only studied until the fourth grade because her financial situation was difficult at that time. She currently lives with her 25-year-old daughter, who suffers from mental problems. Elena covers all of her daughter's food and medical expenses.

Elena makes a living in domestic work, washing clothes for other people in her city. She also invests in products such as lotion so that she can sell them to acquaintances. From these two business activities, she earns an income for her family. She needs this loan to buy a variety of lotions so that she can sell them in the urban area.

She dreams of giving her daughter all that she needs so that she does not lack for anything. Her daughter needs plenty of care due to her mental problems.

loans.use: to buy a variety of lotions to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José de 21 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, originario de  Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia y amigos. Debido a las condiciones económicas en la que vive lamentablemente no pudo estudiar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar, ingeniería civil. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida casera como : pollo asado, pollo en caldo, carne asada, arroz relleno, carne desmenuzada, queso frito, frijoles, pescado frito, manuelitas.  El negocio está enfocado a personas trabajadoras,  estudiantes  de determinadas empresas y universidades, la cual ya tienen un arreglo diario con el Sr. para la venta de la comida, y la forma de recuperación de sus ingresos es quincenal o semanal. Ella dedica  su negocio unas ocho horas diarias desde la preparación de la comida hasta la venta de la misma. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de materia prima para su negocio como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, verduras, condimentos, bolsas, platos descartables, vasos descartables, cubiertos, cuchillos, manteles, servilletas, margarinas, harina. José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old, single, and has no children. He is originally from Leon, a place that is located in the western part of the country. José is known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his family and friends. Unfortunately, due to his financial situation, he was not able to study for a degree. He would have liked to have studied civil engineering.

Thanks to his effort and his desire to move forward, José has managed a business of selling home-cooked food. These dishes include roasted chicken, chicken soup, roasted meat, rice stuffing, shredded meat, fried cheese, beans, fried fish, and stuffed crepes. His business is targeted at working people, such as company employees and university students, who have made a daily routine of buying food from him. José spends approximately eight hours a day preparing the food before he has to sell it.

The purpose of this loan is to provide operating capital that he can invest in his business. He will buy supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, condiments, bags, disposable plates, disposable cups, cutlery, tablecloths, napkins, margarine, and flour.

José appreciates that assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for his food business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia has operates a business selling food. With this loan of 20,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 55 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora que actualmente vive con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos, la crianza de gallinas criollas y pollos de engorde, su hogar está conformado por 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela y le colaboran en el trabajo.

Máximo se dedica a la agricultura, pero también sabe hacer otros oficios como la albañilería, la agricultura la realiza con el propósito de cubrir la necesidad alimentaria de su familia, y la albañilería la aprendió primeramente trabajando como ayudante de albañil y luego de 5 años fue poniendo en practica sus conocimientos. 

Él necesita mucho de este créditio, para construir un granja de pollos de engorde, ya que su esposa tiene experiencia en la crianza de pollos, ademas poseen dos galeras que no las tienen en uso y quieren aprovecharla.

Entre los objetivos de Máximo están seguir trabajando el la agricultura y aprovechar alguna oportunidad de negocio para sacar adelante a toda su familia y que no les faltde nada.
texts.en:
Máximo is a very hard-working 55-year-old who lives with his wife and family of three children. His wife is responsible for household chores and raising free-range and broiler chickens, while his children help him out with work when they are not in school.

Máximo works in agriculture in order to meet his family's food needs, but he is also skilled in other trades such as masonry. He originally learnt the trade while working as an apprentice, and after five years put his knowledge into practice.

He really needs this loan so he can build a broiler chicken farm, as his wife is experienced in chicken-rearing, and they also have two disused chicken sheds that they would like to make use of.

Máximo's goals include to keep working in agriculture while taking advantage of any business opportunity that will allow his whole family to get ahead and not want for anything.

loans.use: to build a broiler chicken farm

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen, 24, is a married woman and the mother of 4 children; two of her children are also shown in the photo. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw.
