He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now his vehicle requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Yasmeen has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to purchase new tires and some auto spare parts. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal was born in 1980. She is married and lives with her husband and her six children in a sector of Jordan called Madaba. She has been trying her best to support her husband to improve their living conditions by running her project of selling clothes at her house for the past year. 

Now she needs to expand it by buying a larger quantity of clothes to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz is 35 years old, a vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of five children. 

She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Shanaz’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She wants to grow her business.

She requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village, and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a farmer living in the Kitale area of North rift Kenya with his three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been farming for eight years, and his primary income sources are milk, eggs, maize, beans; he also has a retail business. 

He stated that he enjoys poultry farming most. His greatest challenge are diseases and expensive poultry feed.

Evans chose Juhudi Kilimo because he saw his neighbours doing very well in farming because of the Juhudi Kilimo loans.

During the training,he learnt that MFIS give short term loans to low income earners.

Through this loan, he will be able to educate his children comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 40 years old, a married woman, and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Zahida’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Zahida has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, along with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Zahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, along with some auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma was born in 1974. She is married, and lives with her husband and her seven children in a sector of Jordan called Madaba. She has been trying her best to support her husband to improve their living conditions by running her project of selling clothes and accessories at her house for the past two year. 

Now she needs to expand her project by opening her own store, where she can sell her products easily and raise her profit. 

But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to open her own clothing and accessories store

loans.name: Shahzia

texts.en:
Shahzia is 33-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community, and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with the packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle, and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 25-year-old married woman. She is happily doing business in shoe making. She beautifully makes shoes in different colors, designs and sizes at home, and then she sells them in the local market at reasonable prices. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to earn income for the family. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Saima requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase leather material, plastic soles and heels in different sizes, with some spools of thread in various colors to increase her production. 

It will allow her to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase leather material, plastic soles and heels in different sizes, with some spools of thread in various colors

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima viene de una familia humilde, y trabajadora, se encuentra trabajando como Empleada en una casa comercial, y también está estudiando.
La carrera que está siguiendo es la de enfermería, ya que siempre quiso poder ayudar a las demás personas. Su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar en forma independiente y ser una profesional muy destacada en su campo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de manutención y también sus cuotas de universidad. Agradece por esta oportunidad de seguir estudiando que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Fatima comes from a humble, hardworking family.  She works in a commercial home and also attends school.

She is studying to become a nurse because she has always wanted to help others.  Her aspiration is to have a career and begin working on her own and stand out in her field.

She is asking for this loan to pay her tuition and university fees.  She is grateful for the opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay tuition and fees.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support.

The previous loan helped her to support her motorcycle business.

Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy another second-hand motorcycle for the business.

loans.use: to buy another second-hand motorcycle for the business.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, age 49, is a married woman. She has been involved in a business of manufacturing shoes for many years, with the support of her husband, also shown in the photo. They have become famous in their town for providing the best quality shoes; they earn a sufficient amount of income to bear their household expenditures. 

She is the mother of seven children, is an energetic person, and eager to support her family. She is liable to fulfill the basic necessities of her children, including food, health and education. 

It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs.55,000 to buy additional material for shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. 

In this way they can handle the growing demand of their shoes in the market and hence can better support their family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam was born in 1965. She is married, and a mother of four living in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. 

Heyam has been trying her best to support her husband in providing her children with the best education by running her project of selling blankets and home products for the past three years. 

She is now planning to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of home products to bring her a good profit in order to raise her income. 

But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is 35 years old and provides for four members in her family with the earnings from her business, a small beauty salon, that she has established in her home. 

She is requesting a loan to buy new tools and cosmetic products that are necessary to expand her business, in hopes that she can expand it more and attract more customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and needed tools for her beauty salon

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma appreciates Kiva lenders for their continued support towards helping her financially. Beside the retail shop, Fatuma operates a green grocery business.

She is requesting for a loan of ksh.35,000 to purchase tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for her business.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for her business

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 45 years old, a married woman, and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a gardener by profession.  He provides these services to the people of their locality. He is very experienced in his work, and earns a sufficient amount of income to bear their household expenditures.

In order to improve the quality of his work, he needs to purchase a new grass cutting machine, along with seasonal flowers. 

For this reason, Jamila has applied a loan of Rs. 40,000 through Kashf Foundation.  

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new grass cutting machine along with seasonal flowers.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal was born in 1960. She is married and has 12 children. Her husband is a retired man who currently works in agriculture. His business is not letting him be able to cover his children's needs by himself. 

Nawal started working in sewing four years ago to help her husband to earn a better income. She started her project with one sewing machine. 

Now she needs a loan to buy more fabric and to purchase another sewing machine to be able to run her business perfectly.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and another sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
These three ladies are part of the group called Arise and Shine, who live in the same neighborhood and meet every week to repay loans, and discuss saving and training. They will need a total amount of GHS 1,900 to develop their businesses.

They are presented by Eunice, standing on the right in the photograph. Eunice is married and has children. She is 29, and works selling bed sheets and plates. She has financial burdens, since her children go to school and help her husband to take care of the house needs.

She starts her work day at 8 AM and ends at 4 PM. She has seven years of experience in this business. 

Eunice is seeking this loan to bolster her working capital and meet customer demand by buying more bed sheets to sell to customers. 

In the future she would like to increase her revenues by diversifying her offerings and attracting new customers.

.

loans.use: To meet customer demand by buying more bed sheets to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, maize, cereals, salt, and other retail products.

loans.name: Rawda

texts.en:
Rawda was born in 1957. She is married and has two daughters. Her husband is a retired man. 

Rawda has been trying her best to support her husband and daughters financially by selling curtains that she sews at her house; she does embroidery on them.  She has been doing this for the past five years. Sewing was a hobby to her, and she used it to earn money to cover her family needs. 

Now she needs to buy more fabric to raise her productivity. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for her business

loans.name: Chiedza

texts.en:
Chiedza is 18 years old and lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools helping students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning. She started a business selling shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets at the local market in 2013 when she finished school. She really loves her business and would like to increase her sales volume in the future. 

Chiedza is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase more shirts, dresses, shoes and jackets for her business. She intends to use the proceeds to improve her standard of living, and through the expansion of the business, create employment in her community.

loans.use: to increase stock for her clothing business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es soltera no tiene hijos , vive en casa de sus padres la misma se encuentra ubicada en la Comunidad Arajllanga.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundaria. se dedica a la produccion de queso  .
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ganado vacuno para asi poder cumplir con sus requerimiento y produccion de queso.
El sueño de Roxana  es tener varias lecheras para  poder cumplir con sus obligaciones asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Roxana is single, has no children and lives in her parents' house which is situated in the Arajllanga community.
She was only able to complete secondary school and she now dedicates herself to producing cheese.
She needs this loan to buy cattle so that she can in this way keep up with demand and produce more cheese.
Roxana's dream is to have milking cows so that she can continue to fulfill her obligations and have a better income.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu appreciates the previous loan that enabled her to pay school fees for her children. Saumu still prepares food.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.30,000 to purchase utensils, wheat flour, beans and sugar for her business.

She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, wheat flour, beans and sugar for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more electrical machines for his business

loans.name: E.m Standard A Group

texts.en:
“Paying for educational expenses when one is a daily wage earner is a difficult job,” says Inao. She and her husband do sand sieving as their main occupation. She is the featured borrower for Standard High School (A) group. She and her son are pictured with their hands raised. Ten women members from the same school who are ready to take the leap for their children’s education form the group. The Group is called Standard High School (A)

Five boys to feed and also to pay for basic needs sometimes trouble the parent. Inao says that government-run schools in the rural areas are negligent and careless towards the students, and this affects theie career in the school. With this reason, she has put her five boys in a private school where the teachers can give extra care and concern. 

Inao's main occupation is sand sieving. She and her husband work six days a week and earn their labour charge only. Being a labourer is the most difficult way of earning an income; there is no excuse when one is ill. You do not get paid for being absent.

In order that their children can reach their intellectual capacity and achieve academic success, she and her husband try their best and send them to good schools. The hurdle is the expenses incurred for the education and they usually fail to pay the monthly fees. The children are asked by the school heads to clear their fees before the examinations start. “I want my kids to be tension-free when they are in school,” says Inao, who is very disappointed in herself for making the children go through this.

The Kiva education loan will enlighten her children's education. She will pay for the admission fees, uniforms for all seasons, text books, stationery and other necessary annual expenditures. She and her husband will work together to repay the loan and wish to continue working with Kiva. 

The rest of the group members will use the loan to pay for school expenses and other annual expenses. They are grateful and acknowledge the work Kiva has done for them. Inao says she will always remain grateful.

loans.use: To pay for admission fees, text books, stationery and other necessary annual expenses for the academic year 2014.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade lives in South Bogor, about one hour from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as the rainy city. 

Ade manages a small shop selling groceries, snacks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Ade is married and living with his daughter and wife in the family home.  

Ade joined Ruma one and a half years ago because he wanted to sell new products.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ade sees improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $79 to $80 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is a 21-year-old single woman living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers at schools in her community offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity, producing about 150 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2013 when her family started facing financial difficulties.

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Valentine would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets, such as Food World. Valentine will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable her to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production.

loans.name: Revai

texts.en:
Revai is 27 years old and married with two children. She resides in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. She is known as a pillar of support in her community because of her volunteer work helping the elderly with the upkeep of their homes. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools to improve the wellbeing of students. In addition, Revai rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.

With the Kiva loan Revai will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and t-shirts to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and one day open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her children’s education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to stock her market stall.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children and resides in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a janitor in local schools because she believes that children should learn in a clean and healthy environment. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools to improve the well-being of students. In addition, Tendai rents a small stall in the Chikomba West business center where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.

With this Kiva loan, Tendai will increase her stocks which will improve sales. Her dream is to own her own clothing store. Owning her own store will bring stability to her business and will enable her to create employment as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to stock her market stall.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Para Rosa lo más importante es que los clientes reciban el mejor servicio, con un trato cálido, que se sientan en confianza, que sea un lugar familiar donde puedan encontrarse con sus vecinos, que los ayuden cuando soliciten algo, que los guíen hasta los productos, que sea hecho a la medida de sus necesidades básica de compra. Todo se encuentra muy fresco, gracias a la alta rotación de sus productos y de calidad.

Ella vive en alquiler ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz. Necesita credito para comprar refrescos y alimentos (enlatados, embolsados) para su tienda de abarrotes 

El sueño de Rosa es vivir en casa propia y ampliar su tienda, pues asi mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
For Rosa, the most important thing is that her customers receive the best service, that they are treated well, that they trust her, that her store is a familiar place where customers can meet with neighbors. She also wants to help them when they need something, to guide them to the products, and make their basic necessities tailor made to them. 

Everything is very fresh due to the high product turnover and quality of the products. She lives in a rental located in the city of La Paz. She needs a loan to purchase beverages and food (canned goods, bagged goods) for her grocery store. 

Rosa's dream is to live in her own home and expand her store so that she can increase her income and quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase food and beverages for her grocery store.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en: Scolastica appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her tailoring business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase tailoring materials, fabrics and a new sewing machine. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials, fabrics and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Ana es una mujer trabjadora, repsonsable y emprendedora. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de la integridad de Ana. Con el fin de de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared y para dividir una habitación y para cambiar el techo de la vivienda ya que se encuentra deteriorado. Espera poder contar el apoyo de FUSAI dado que o cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso por su cuenta.
texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her 17-year-old son. Ana is a hardworking, responsible, and entrepreneurial woman. Many people provide excellent references regarding Ana's integrity.

With the goal of improving her and her family's home conditions, she requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a wall to divide a room and to re-build the roof of the home since it is deteriorated.

She hopes to count on FUSAI's help to make the payment on her behalf.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand, galvanized laminate, and wood to build a wall and repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Sholeh

texts.en:
Sholeh lives in South Bogor, about one hour from Jakarta. Bogor is known as the rainy city. Sholeh manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Sholeh is single.  

Sholeh joined Ruma one month ago because he want to sell new products. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Sholeh sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $15 to $16 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to expand more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Meruna

texts.en:
Meruna, 27 years old, is a homemaker who lives in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, mud and straw) with her husband, Amzat, and two children. Both Meruna and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They can hardly afford the educational expenses of their children. One of them receives education, studying in grade 7. The second one is below the school-going age.

Meruna's husband is engaged in agriculture. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. His agricultural business is the only source of income for the family. 

As life is getting more expensive with time, Meruna needs to help her husband so she has chosen this potato cultivation business. She applied for loans to BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. The demand for potatoes is very high in the local market.

She hopes this will give them more profit to improve their quality of life and help her children's education. In the future, they want to buy a cycle-van to carry their vegetables to the local market.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as to Kiva for giving her the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Nerri

texts.en:
Nerri runs a small stall that sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Nerri lives in South Bogor a semi-urban area about one hour from Jakarta.  Nerri is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Nerri began working with Ruma 2 months ago because she wanted to increase her income by selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last two months, she has had around $71 to $72 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (notebooks, pencils, colored pencils, cardboard, and others).

loans.name: Moises Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del Río Jequetepeque que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una pequeña orquesta que brinda servicios musicales, para reuniones familiares, cumpleaños, matrimonios, quinceañeros y todo tipo de evento, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para dar mantenimiento a sus instrumentos y una segunda parte para comprar materiales para separar una habitación donde realiza los ensayos con su orquesta y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Zaña, a community located near the Jequetepeque River that has flourished due to agriculture, commerce, and the cattle raising industry. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

He has a small orchestra that provides musical services for family reunions, birthday parties, weddings, quinceañeros, and all types of events. He has a considerable number of customers. 

He has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to maintain his instruments and purchase materials to separate a room where the orchestra rehearses so that he can continue providing services.

loans.use: to maintain his musical instruments and repair the location where the orchestra rehearses.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1958. She lives with her husband and four children in a sector of Jordan called Salt. Alia has been trying her best to contribute to covering the household expenses. For the past five years she has worked on a small project, sewing on buttons and repairing clothes for her family, friends and neighbors. Then she bought a sewing machine and started a small clothing repair shop beside her house, where she repairs clothes in addition to customizing outfits. She has just bought a new sewing machine, and now she is applying for a loan to buy more fabric to do her work perfectly and increase her profits by raising her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for her business.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna was born in 1960. She is married, a mother of three living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is retired. Muna has been giving support to her husband in covering their children’s needs and the household expenses for the past two years by selling electric appliances. She started her project selling a few of them. Now she needs to expand the number of her products and increase their variety, in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. But she doesn't have enough money to take this step, which is why she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more electric appliances to resell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a local church leader in the large Mukuru Kayaba slum in Nairobi, Kenya, where he was born and raised. He also runs a small retail business in the same area. Peter has witnessed the challenges posed by poor sanitation in his neighborhood, and he has taken it upon himself to identify a solution to this issue. He then learned about the Fresh Life toilet. Peter is applying for a loan to help him buy and run two Fresh Life Toilets, which he hopes will go a long way toward solving the sanitation issue. He wishes to expand his franchise and increase the impact of these facilities on the sanitation problem in his area.

loans.use: to buy and run two Fresh Life Toilets in order to improve sanitation in the slum where he is a church leader.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo-3 Group

texts.en: These women are part of the group called Ekome Feemo-3 Group, who have been together for a long time. The members always work very hard to take care of their families. Evelyn is the general group leader, and she is known for being very enterprising. She works from her shop, where she has been selling cooking utensils and plastic products for eight years. This is her seventh loan from ID-Ghana and her second from Kiva. She is very good at customer service, is a very kind person, and has many customers, which is why her business is doing well. She would like to continue to grow her business. She is applying for this loan to buy cooking utensils and plastic products to sell to her customers. The group members are very grateful for the opportunity they have been given to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and plastic products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en: Tendai is 24 years old, married, and a mother of two. She lives Hurungwe District. Tendai is an entrepreneur working with other young women in her rural community, encouraging them to be economically independent. She supports her family by selling fish, such as dried kapenta (a small, sardine-like fish) and dried bream in nearby towns. She started her business in 2012, when she began to face financial difficulties, and the business has enabled her to support her family and provide for their basic needs. Tendai knows there is a high demand for the kapenta she sells and would love to improve the business. With this Kiva loan, she plans to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk at fisheries. This will help boost her profits and will enable her to raise enough money to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk at fisheries for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Martha Rosario

texts.es: Martha, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara cerca de Cofradía. Cortes.  Desde hace dos años estableció su propia pulpería para la venta de productos alimenticios como es arroz, azúcar, frijoles, embutidos, lácteos, refrescos, condimentos, churros, pan, huevos etc. Ha solicitado 5,000 lempiras para comprar abarrotes como ser lácteos, harina, pan, arroz, azúcar, y otros. Tiene como meta mantenerlo surtido para aumentar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children and lives in the Quimistán, Santa Bárbara municipality near Cofradía.

Two years ago she established her own shop selling food products like rice, beans, meats, milk, soft drinks, spices, churros, bread, eggs, etc.

She has asked for a loan of 5,000 lempiras to buy groceries such as milk, flour, bread, rice, sugar, and others. She aims to keep up her stock so that she can increase her family's revenue.

loans.use: buy groceries such as milk, flour, bread, rice, sugar, and others to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to move the business to larger premises

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Docus is a young woman aged 35 who is married with 5 children. She currently resides in Chikomba West District.  She volunteers as a Community Health trainer in her community, actively disseminating health information.

She operates a small retail shop in her community where she sells a variety of grocery products such as soap, eggs, sugar, flour, milk, juice, salt and mealie meal (ground maize or corn). The store is conveniently located since it is the only one in the vicinity. 

The Kiva loan will enable her to expand her business by increasing her stock and raise her sales. She hopes to create employment in her community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop

loans.name: Remina

texts.en: Remina is a 29-year-old woman who lives in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. She is very involved in her community as a volunteer at a hostel for girls who walk long distances to school. Remina also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags and shoes. She started her business in April 2013 as a way to support her three siblings since she is the family’s primary breadwinner. She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like to expand. This Kiva loan will enable her to stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, and bags to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to fully support her three siblings.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 49-year-old married woman from the small village of Barogharia in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband and four children (two sons and two daughters). They are receiving education. 

Both Fatema and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Fatema is a homemaker and her husband is engaged in a small business. The earning of her husband is not sufficient to maintain their lifestyle and the expenses of the household. Fatema chose BJS (Kiva’s partner) for taking a loan as she wants to purchase a cow. She hopes to earn a profit from this business as there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality in the present market. She needs to start this business to give additional financial support to her family. She wants to give proper education to their children with the profit.

Fatema is thanking BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start a dairy product business.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul lives in South Bogor, about one hour from Jakarta.  Bogor is known as the rainy city. Abdul manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and  mobile phone airtime credit. Abdul is single.  

Abdul joined Ruma four months ago because he wanted to sell new products. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Abdul sees improvements in his shop. For the last three months, he has earned an average of $12 to $13 in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is 43 years old and married. She and her husband are raising their only son. Jyotsna has an education up to primary level and her husband studied up to grade 9. Jyotsna and her husband are in the animal husbandry and farming business. Her husband, Ashok, cultivates potatoes in their own farmland. They live in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Jyotsna is very responsible, outgoing and cheerful. She has been associated with this business for five years, when her husband's business was not going well. As a result of her hard work, now she has two goats and one dairy cow. But together they are unable to earn sufficient money to cover the necessities of their family.

With an aim to further developing her business, Jyotsna has applied for a loan from BJS. She plans to purchase a cow with the loan. She will start a milk products business such as curd, butter, cheese, etc. with the additional milk. She will sell the products to her neighbours. It is a lucrative business as the products have great demand in the market.

Jyotsna hopes to help her husband financially for the improvement of their family income and give higher education to their son. She also wants to invest the profits from the loan in acquiring more cattle to build a cattle herd to earn more for their secured future.


She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a business of supplying milk and dairy products.

loans.name: Thandiwe

texts.en:
Thandiwe is 21 years old, single and living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. Thandiwe is well-known in her community for the work she does with the less privileged.

She is currently operating a business buying and selling new and second-hand clothes. She sells clothing such as jackets, shirts and shoes at her local flea market. She started the business when she finished high school to support herself and her family. 

Thandiwe will use the Kiva loan to purchase a bale of clothes, which will give her a variety of new products to offer. This will boost her business tremendously and increase her clientele. She loves her business and dreams of opening a boutique. She intends to use the profits to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo, a sus 46 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo, por lo que toda la responsabilidad económica del hogar recayó sobre ella. Es por esta razón que, desde hace 10 años se dedicó a vender mercancía, inicialmente ofrecía productos por catálogo, pero, poco tiempo después se le presentó la oportunidad de traer mercancía desde Estados Unidos, la cual tuvo muy buena aceptación entre sus clientes, generando buenos resultados y ganancias; su clientela está conformada por familiares, amigos, vecinos y los compañeros de la universidad de una de sus hijas; así ha logrado brindar sustento a su familia.
Con la ventaja de que la mercancía que ofrece es de muy buena calidad y a bajo costo, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (bolsos, ropa, accesorios, perfumería) esto le permitirá tener más variedad para satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de su clientela, así mejorará las venta e ingresos para la familia.
Consuelo expresa que su mayor anhelo es abrir un local comercial en el que pueda exhibir todos sus productos y así atraer nueva clientela, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y la rentabilidad, así garantizará una estabilidad económica para seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 46 years old, has three children, and is the head of her household since she separated from her husband.  All of the financial responsibility of the household falls on her.  For this reason, she has worked for 10 years selling merchandise.  She started out offering products by catalog, but a short time later, she was given an opportunity to get merchandise from the United States.  This has had a very good reaction from her customers and generated good results and profits.  Her customers are relatives, friends, neighbors, and friends of her daughter from the university.  This is how she has succeeded in providing for her family.

Since she has an advantage that her merchandise is a good quality and at low cost, she is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise at wholesale prices, including bags, clothing, accessories, and perfumes.  This will allow her to have more variety to satisfy the tastes and requirements of her customers, which will improve her sales and income for her family.

Consuelo says that her greatest wish is to open a store where she can display all of her products and attract new customers, which will reflect an increase in sales and profitability.  That would guarantee a stable financial situation to continue supporting her children so they have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise at wholesale (bags, clothing, accessories, and perfumes).

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es:
Juanito tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de cafeto, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 5 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, Juanito ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra a los jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su finca de café y de esta manera tener una producción adecuada para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juanito, age 29, lives with his wife and children in the Callayuc district, a community with green scenery.  The population there devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is located in the Cutervo Province, Región Cajamarca, in the northern highlands of Perú.

He devotes himself to agriculture, especially coffee crops.  He has been doing this work for five years.  His wife helps him with this work.

Juanito has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativea for 2,000 soles.  He will use the loan to pay for day laborers to perform maintenance on his coffee farm.  This way he will have an adequate production to offer his customers.  This will generate greater profits for his family.

loans.use: to pay for day laborers to perform maintenance on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Binu

texts.en:
Binu is a 27-year-old housewife of Raypara village, Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Monglu and they have two children (one son and one daughter). They send their children to school.
 
The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where usually potato is grown.  She and her husband work hard and always have high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. As the income is only seasonal, the earning is not sufficient to maintain their lifestyle and the expenses of their children's education. 

She wants to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family and so she has applied for the loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. She also hopes her business will ensure her family members and especially her children have a better education and better future. Both the husband and wife desire to buy a cycle van in future for their own use and rent it for another means of income.

Binu is grateful to Kiva and BJS for helping them to overcome all financial hurdles.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking and enterprising woman who thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support that has greatly increased her monthly sales.

Besides the retail shop, Agnes sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Manuela Antonia

texts.es: Manuela, tiene 58 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Ella lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la cría y venta de cerdos, estos animales los vende para destazo en la misma comunidad.  Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 11,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar más cerdos para engorde y vender. Su plan es aumentar el negocio para que su familia tenga bienestar económico.
texts.en:
Manuela is 58 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the town of Arizona, Atlántida.  For 10 years, she has worked raising and selling pigs, which she sells in her community.  

She has requested her fourth loan for 11,000 lempiras so that she can purchase more pigs to fatten and sell.  Her plan is to expand her business so that her family has financial well-being.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y vive con su esposo y un nieto en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida.
Hace cuatro años que comenzó con una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como lácteos, arroz, azúcar, pan, refrescos, churros, dulces, café, pastillas, frijoles etc. Ella se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería en casa y su esposo vende medicinas, como pastillas y otros. Ha decidido solicitar un tercer préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio con más productos como granos básicos, lácteos, refrescos, azúcar, manteca, huevos, condimentos etc. Su objetivo es tener mas capital de trabajo para mantener surtido el negocio. Su meta es aumentar las ventas y que el negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Juana is 62 years old, married, and has five adult children.  She lives with her husband and grandson in the town of Esparta, Atlántida.  Four years ago, she started a small grocery store that sells products like dairy products, rice, sugar, bread, drinks, churros, desserts, coffee, pills, and beans.  She runs the store out of her home, and her husband sells medicines, like pills.  

She has requested a third loan for 10,000 lempiras to stock her store with more items, such as basic grains, dairy products, drinks, sugar, butter, eggs, and condiments.  Her goal is to have more working capital to keep her store well stocked.  Her goal is to increase her sales so that the business grows.

loans.use: to stock her store with more products, such as basic grains, dairy products, drinks, sugar, butter, eggs, and condiments.

loans.name: Tambudzai

texts.en:
Tambudzai is a 26-year-old business woman and a mother of one living in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide working with students at local schools to help improve their learning by teaching them life and study skills. Additionally, she offers psychosocial support to young people in her community.

Tambudzai’s hard work and ambition led her to own and run a business at the local flea market where she sells clothing, accessories, and shoes. She started the business in 2009 when she got married and began facing financial difficulties. Currently, Tambudzai’s profits barely meet her family’s needs.  

With a Kiva loan, Tambudzai will purchase large bales of clothing to increase and diversify her stock and expand her business profits. This will enable her to provide for family. Her hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothing

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
Celsa tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno lechero, dedicándose a vender leche fresca desde hace 4 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para mayor producción de leche y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes mediante la elaboración de quesos, quesillos y leche fresca, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Celsa is 54 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in the Lagunas district, a community dedicated to farming, commerce, and raising livestock located in the province of Chiclayo in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

She works raising and selling dairy cattle.  She has sold fresh milk for four years.  She is requesting this loan for 3000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed for better milk production.  This will allow her to offer cheese, soft cheese, and fresh milk to her customers to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for better milk production.

loans.name: Dúo Villas Group

texts.es: Dúo villas conformadas por Sandy quien es propietaria de una estética de belleza ubicada en la localildad donde vive,tiene este negocio desde hace ya tres años es madre de una nena de 1 año por lo cual ella aprovecha a poder surtir y comprar el equipo necesario para su estética de belleza ella menciona que es importante tener la mayoría de  equipo y poder actualizarse en relación a modas para que de esa manera ella pueda brindar un ambiente y servicio agradable a las personas que la buscan y es por eso que ella toca las puertas  DE kiva para que se le otorgue un crédito para poder comprar la mayoría de equipo necesario y agradece desde ya su ayuda.
texts.en: The "Villas" duo has Sandy as one of its members. She is the owner of a beauty salon, which she runs out of her home. She has had this business for three years now. Sandy is a mother to a one-year-old girl. Sandy wants to be able to stock up her business and buy the necessary equipment for her beauty salon. Sandy tells us that it is important to have the majority of the equipment available for her business and to be up-to-do in order to offer a pleasant atmosphere in her work, and good service, to those who come to her. It is for this reason that she has come to apply for a loan from Kiva. With it she will be able to buy the majority of the equipment she needs. Sandy is grateful for Kiva's help.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Iris Lastenia

texts.es: Iris, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Tiene su propio negocio de pulpería en su casa desde hace 10 años donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, azúcar, refrescos, churros, pan, verduras, harina, huevos jabón etc. Anteriormente vendía pan de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar productos para vender en su negocio y con una parte va cancelar una pequeña deuda con otra institución. Doña Iris tiene la idea en un futuro de lograr construir un local solo para la pulpería.
texts.en: Iris is 47 years old. She is a single mother of two children. She lives in the town of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. She has had her own grocery shop in her home for 10 years where she sells basic family staple products such as rice, beans, butter, sugar, drinks, churros, bread, vegetables, flower, eggs, soap, etc. Previously she sold bread as a street vendor. The credit she is requesting is for $525 to buy products to sell in her business and with part going towards cancelling a small debt she has with another institution. Iris has the idea to in the future construct her own shop for the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her business and with a part going to cancel a small debt with another institution.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria, sigue dedicándose a su negocio de salón de belleza, la socia trabaja con todos sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios para sus distintos compromisos, la socia realiza, cortes, tintes, peinados entre otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como tijeras, tintes, secadoras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gloria continues with her beauty salon. She works with her customers who request services for different event. Gloria does haircuts, dyes, styling and more. Gloria has had this business for years and she finds it satisfying both financially and personally. Gloria wants to be able to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Gloria is applying for a loan in order to buy materials such as dyes, scissors, hair driers and more.

Gloria is grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as dyes, scissors, hair driers and more.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad con paisajes verdes, de un clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto, cultivando este producto desde hace 6 años, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, su esposa le apoya en esta labor , todas las mañanas ordeña el ganado lechero para posteriormente preparar el queso fresco de manera artesanal para comercializarlo en el mercado de su distrito.

Luciano ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y pago de mano de obra a jornaleros y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luciano is 39 years old and lives with his parents in the Santo Tomás district, a community with green landscapes and a varied climate in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands. Here the people make a living in farming - particularly growing coffee -, in business, and in cattle raising. 

Luciano works in farming, especially growing coffee. He has been doing this for six years and also raises and sells bovine cattle. His wife helps him with this work: every morning she milks the dairy cattle in order to later sell the homemade fresh cheese in the district market.

Luciano has applied for a loan of 4000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy manure to look after his crops and to pay labourers. He can then have his products ready to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy manure for looking after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a 40-year-old woman, married with three children and living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. Miria is very involved in her local community and gives back to others. She does this by offering home-based care services and volunteering as a Camfed Learner guide, working with schools in her community and helping students gain studying and life skills. 

Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2012, when her family started facing financial difficulties. 
 
Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Miria would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. Miria will use the Kiva loan to purchase more chemicals, chick feed, broiler concentrate and fencing to increase production. She hopes to put her children and two cousins through school.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, chick feed, broiler concentrate and fencing to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep to sell

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad de paisajes verdes, es una comunidad de relieve accidentado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee ocho reses de su propiedad, tiene sembrado 10 Has de inverna de su propiedad donde cría su ganado vacuno, junto a su esposa se esfuerzan en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de toretes para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Augusto is 29 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the Santo Tomás district, a community with green landscapes and uneven topography located in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.  The people there work in farming, commerce, and raising livestock.  

He works raising and selling cattle.  He owns eight cows and has 10 hectares of land where he raises his livestock together with his wife.  He is requesting a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase young bulls to later fatten them and sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls to fatten.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El socio Marco Antonio pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI; él socio tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias estudiando la carrera de biología, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio desea poder continuar estudiando para poder trabajar en una buena empresa y así poder desenvolverse profesionalmente, él socio desea ser un buen profesional en el futuro.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de una laptop para sus estudios.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank. He is 22 years old, single and is studying biology at university. Marco is responsible and diligent. He wants to be able to continue studying in order to work for a good company and develop professionally. Marco wants to have a good profession in the future.

Marco is applying for a loan in order to buy a laptop for his studies.

Marco is grateful for this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.
She is asking for a loan to buy utensils, wheat flour, beans, sugar, and milk for her cafe. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy utensils, wheat flour, beans, sugar, and milk for her cafe.

loans.name: Tapiwa Margie

texts.en:
Tapiwa is 32-years old, married with two children and residing in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Tapiwa has the opportunity to work with schools in her community, helping students gain studying and life skills. Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 250 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to local residents. She started the business in 2012 when her family started facing financial difficulties.  

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Tapiwa would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. Tapiwa will use the Kiva loan to purchase more chick feed, broiler concentrate, and fencing to increase production. She hopes to put her two children and two cousins through school.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed and fencing to increase broiler bird capacity.

loans.name: Nosta

texts.en:
Nosta is 30 years old and married with two children. She currently lives in Hurungwe where she volunteers as a Camfed Community Health Trainer and Learner Guide, striving to improve the health and well-being of her community. She actively encourages attendance and retention of children in school through home visits. Nosta also rents a stall at the local flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in 2010 as a way of supporting herself and her children since she is the family’s breadwinner. Nosta is very pleased with what she has achieved so far and would like to expand her business.

The Kiva loan will enable her to stock up on jackets, shoes, shirts, skirts, dresses, and bags to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing to fill her market stall.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in the coastal area of Ghana. She is a 46-year-old single woman. She has been selling glasses for five years. 

Patience is requesting a loan of GHS 900 to buy more glasses to sell to customers. This is her fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she has repaid her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy more glasses to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock and improving her sales volume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
Laureana tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el Caserío de Mamaca, una zona rural del distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad de clima caluroso su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pequeña bodega, ubicada en su propio domicilio la cual viene funcionando hace más de 05 años, también se dedica al cultivo y comercio de limas cuenta con una finca de lima, tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Laureana is 46 years old.  She lives with her husband and son in the town of Mamaca, in a rural area in the San Felipe district located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.  The community has a hot climate and the people work in agriculture, especially growing fruit trees, commerce, and raising livestock.

She works at a small grocery store that is located in her home.  She has had the business for more than 5 years.  She also works growing and selling lemons on her farm.  She has a lot of experience with the business.  

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase a variety of products to offer to customers and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with two children all of whom go to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rental bills and electricity.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Zinav

texts.en:
Zinav had a dream ever since she was young to open a cosmetics salon. She gave her first waxing treatment to her best friend when she was just 15 and ever since she has been learning and honing her skills. Zinav moved her salon recently to a more centrally and attractive location.

Zinav needs this loan to assist with paying for renovations, new flooring and materials.

Zinav wants to open a full cosmetics salon including laser treatments with the latest machines and staff to take care of treatments.

loans.use: to renovate her new salon location

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, algodón y frutales, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, cuyes, cerdos, desde hace más de 15 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 63 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún. It is a community that is dedicated to agriculture, especially growing rice, cotton and fruit as well as to trade and cattle ranching. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He has worked raising and selling animals such as ducks, chickens, turkeys, guinea pigs, and pigs for more than 15 years. His business is located in the back part of his house. He has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed to fatten up his animals and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra a jornaleros y compra de abono para el cultivo de café y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Callayuc. It is a community that is dedicated to agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru.

He works in agriculture, especially growing coffee. His wife helps him do this work. He has asked for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to pay the laborers for labor costs and to buy fertilizer for the coffee crop and in this way generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the laborers for labor costs and for fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: zinc sheeting, sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 25-year-old woman who lives in a small town called Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in their own kachha house made of straw, mud and bamboo. Her children go to school and they are in grade 7 and 3. Jyotsna was educated up to grade 4 and her husband is illiterate; he can only sign his name.

Jyotsna's husband, age 42, is a cultivator by profession. He grows vegetables and sells them in the local market. He is the main source of income for the family, but he can't give sufficient financial sustenance to his family.

Jyotsna, though mainly a housewife, has come forward to assist her husband. She has taken out a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to purchase a dairy cow to start a business of milk and dairy products. She will produce dairy products, like cheese, butter, curd, etc., and sell them in the market and in her neighborhood. 

Jyotsna hopes that the new business initiative will give her a chance to have financial stability and an increased monthly income. Her goals are to give her children higher education and upgrade their house to a concrete-made one. She is grateful to BJS for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en:
Tsitsi is a 31-year-old woman from Chikomba West district. She is married with four children. Tsitsi is seen as an extraordinary woman in her village, with a heart for the needy and less privileged.  She volunteers at the local community center, actively helping to keep children in school through guidance and counseling, and life skills development for child headed families. She feels that everyone deserves a chance in life. Tsitsi is currently operating a poultry business, which she started in 2012 and has been running for one and half years. She began the business when she started facing financial difficulties. 

The loan will assist her in purchasing chick feed and broiler chicks to increase her production and boost sales. It will also assist her in building a much bigger fowl run.  Improving her business will help her to increase profits, to take care of her family and her five dependents.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed and broiler chicks.

loans.name: Irma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Irma del Carmen tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad cerca al río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de piqueos y bebidas en el patio de su casa al público desde hace más de 10 años, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de su distrito, son una familia emprendedora, Irma del Carmen ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de cocina para reactivar su negocio y mejorar parte de su vivienda para atender mayor cantidad d e y de esta manera atender a su clientes en un lugar agradable.
texts.en:
Irma del Carmen is 48 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in the Zaña district, a community close to the Jequetepeque river in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region, in the northern mountains of Peru.  The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock.  

She has worked selling snacks and drinks to the public from the patio of her house.  Her husband works at a business in their district.  They are an enterprising family.  

Irma del Carmen is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase cooking supplies to restart her business and improve part of her home to serve a larger number of customers in a nice location.

loans.use: to purchase cooking supplies.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 22-year-old mother of one. She lives in the Chikomba District West District of Zimbabwe. As a volunteer Camfed Learner guide, Marjorie supports students to develop their wellbeing through life skills education. She is also actively involved in the cause for keeping children in school through school feeding initiatives. Marjorie is currently renting a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, and shoes. She started the business soon after finishing school and has managed to support herself and her family. 

Marjorie will use the Kiva loan to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock levels. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock levels

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en: Tsitsi is a 19-year-old woman who lives in the District of Chikomba West in Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools disseminating health information to students. As the breadwinner of the family, Tsitsi runs a flea market where she sells clothes, bags, and shoes. She started her business in August 2013, to support her three siblings.  She is very proud of what she has achieved so far in her business and would like it to expand. The loan from Kiva will enable her to get more jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, bags, and shoes to sell. She hopes to raise enough money to continue with her own education and to continue supporting her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nokuthula

texts.en:
Nokuthula is a 20-year-old young woman. She is single and currently lives in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. Nokuthula actively assists the elderly and less privileged in her community as well as volunteering in schools teaching life skills education. To make an income, she sells clothing accessories such as jackets, shirts, shorts, skirts, jerseys and pants in the local township. She has managed to cater to her family’s needs during the four months she has been running the business. 

A loan from Kiva will enable her to increase her stock of clothing and expand her business. With an increase in profits, Nokuthula wishes to create employment opportunities in her community.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing and expand her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 21 years old, single, and living in Hurungwe, a district in Zimbabwe. Through her affiliation with Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, Faith volunteers as a Learner Guide encouraging students to stay in school and complete their education. She provides for her family by buying and selling different products such as shoes, soap, rice, and salt. She sells her products from her home but sometimes she also sells from door to door. Faith dreams of opening her own store. 

Faith will use the Kiva loan to open a store and to stock it with products such as shoes, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, snacks, and cotton wool. The shop will be the only one in her area and it will bring stability to her business. This will enable her to improve her current standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to expand her business

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios en su moto carguera desde hace 4 años, es conocido en su comunidad ya que son pocas las personas que ofrecen este servicio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para reparar su motocarguera y de esta manera seguir brindado el servicio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 24 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The community works in agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock.

He has worked providing cargo motorcycle services for four years.  He is well known in his community since there are few people who offer this service.  

He is requesting a loan of 500 nuevos soles to purchase parts to repair his cargo motorcycle so that he can continue providing this service and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts to repair his cargo motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stationery to expand his business.

loans.name: Lainah

texts.en:
Laina is 34 years old. She is married with four children and resides in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe. Laina has been working as a community health trainer, disseminating health information to students and her community. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Laina rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Laina will purchase more stock to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 26 years old and lives in Nyanga District, Zimbabwe. For the past year, Betty has been volunteering in schools and in her community. She recently became a Camfed Learner Guide, striving to improve the health and well-being of students in her community. For the past two years, she has been in the tobacco farming business. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and employ four people on her farm.

The Kiva loan will help her improve production and increase her percentage yield by purchasing tobacco seeds in bulk, reducing shipping costs. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco seeds

loans.name: Priviledge

texts.en:
Privilege is 22 years old. She is a single mother residing in Chikomba West District, Zimbabwe and is known for her volunteer work at community centres. As a Camfed Learner Guide, she strives to improve the well being of both the students and people in her community by teaching life skills. She is also popular with the elderly, whom she assists with chores and upkeep of their homes. Privilege rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits and T-shirts. She has been running this business since 2013 and it has enabled her to support her family.  

Privilege will use the Kiva loan to increase her stock by purchasing more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits and T-shirts. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her further education.

loans.use: to purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits and T-shirts

loans.name: Thandiwe

texts.en:
