Thandiwe is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two children living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. To support her community, Thandiwe is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools to disseminate health information and promote the reduction of HIV and AIDS. To support her family, Thandiwe has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 200 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business in July 2013 when her family began facing financial difficulties. 
 
Thandiwe would very much like to increase her production capacity and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. She hopes to provide for her two children and put them through school.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 30-year-old businesswoman, single, and residing in Chikomba West, a district in Zimbabwe. Eunice volunteers as a community health trainer within the local schools, spreading health information to children, and helping her community fight against HIV/AIDS, as well as poverty. She currently rents a table at the local flea market where she sells clothing accessories such as skirts, blouses, shoes, shirts, pants and stockings. She began the business in 2011 when she started facing financial difficulties. Currently, Eunice’s profits barely meet her family’s needs.  

With a Kiva loan, Eunice will purchase large bales of clothing to increase her stock and expand her business and profits. This will enable her to provide for herself. Her hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stock.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 25-year-old woman who lives in the town of Chikomba, Zimbabwe. She is married and a mother of one. Jeniffer is an aspiring entrepreneur running a home-based hair salon. She started this business when she had her child. She acquired training and experience from working in her friend’s hair salon, but she wanted to be financially independent in order to support herself and her child. She inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur and a devoted carer for the elderly. She would like to move the business to the district center and increase her clientele base. 

The loan will enable her to open her own hair salon and purchase a hair dryer, rollers, ceramic iron or tongs, and hair products needed in her salon. Her hope is to provide for her family and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her salon

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Kanika is a 40-year-old married woman. She received education up to grade 7. Her poverty, ignorance and deprived situation have not allowed her to receive more education. Now Kanika is the mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She is very much optimistic about her children. She wants to give them a good education.

Kanika's husband is a farmer by profession and grows different vegetables. To give financial support, Kanika is associated with a livestock business. Both Kanika and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children – a future not affected by poverty and ignorance.

Now Kanika has decided to start a dairy business. She has taken out a loan to purchase a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream come true. 

Kanika is very happy and thanks Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) as well as Kiva for the monetary support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Sebastiana, la socia continua  dedicándose  a la  producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia tambien se dedica a la venta de comida para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia espera poder agradar su negocio de comida, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como carne, arroz entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Sebastiana continues to dedicate herself to the production and sale of dairy products like milk, cheese, and yogurt. She has been involved in this for many years and it's going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day.

Sebastiana also sells meals to all the customers who request them and she hopes to be able to continue pleasing her customers. Sebastiana is a determined and responsible person; that is how she has managed to advance her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as meat and rice, among other items.

Sebastiana is grateful to Kiva for helping her advance in her activity and she promises to comply with her payments schedule punctually.

loans.use: to buy food inputs such as meat and rice among other items.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia  continua dedicándose a la ganadería y a la  venta de quesos y yogurt, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le  solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una vaca y alimentos.
La socia está feliz con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Soledad continues to work raising livestock and selling cheeses and yogurt.  She has done this work for many years and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day.  She raises her animals to later sell them to customers who order them.  She wants to continue working to support her family.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow and feed.  

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and feed.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store, serving snacks to her customers. She sells assorted food and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a security guard.

Marilou has twenty years experience in this field. She works hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show her responsibility and love to serve not only her family but their community.

Marilou requested this loan to purchase raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger place and continue assisting her family with the additional income. The couple wants to give their children a better education.

The story of Marilou and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC economic development clients.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal by bag for her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 22-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is single, with one child. She began her business because she wants to create income to take care of her child and parent.  

Fatmata runs a retail business; she sells palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week.  Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network within her operation area.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family welfare and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medical drugs for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 38-year-old woman. She is married with 3 children and lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers in schools in her community, offering guidance and support to students through life skills education. She has been successfully running a poultry project for 5 years, producing about 200 broiler birds every 6 weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business when she lost her job.  

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Judith would very much like to increase her sales volumes and become a supplier to major supermarkets such as Food World. Judith will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable her to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 22-year-old young single mother of one living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. She rents a small shop where she sells groceries such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationery. Charity actively inspires young women in her community to be economically empowered as entrepreneurs. She started the business in 2012 as a mobile market and is very pleased with how far she has come.

Charity will use this Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs as well as create employment in her community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
Memory is a 21-year-old single businesswoman currently living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. She rents a small stall at the local flea market where she sells cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, and shoes at the local business center. Memory inspires young women in her community as both an entrepreneur and as a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students about their well-being. She started the business in 2012 when she finished school so that she could provide for herself. 

With this Kiva loan, Memory will purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, panties, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock levels. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To increase her stock so as to boost sales

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 37 years old, married with three children, and lives in the Chikomba District, Zimbabwe. Abigail actively supports schools in her community by volunteering as a janitor. She strives to promote a healthy learning environment as she knows that it has a great impact on the way children learn. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools to improve the well-being of students. In addition, Abigail rents a small stall at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year and it has enabled her to support her family.  

She will use the Kiva loan to improve her sales by increasing and diversifying her inventory. Her hope is to expand the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to secure her further education as well as provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to improve her sales by increasing and diversifying her inventory

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo is a 31-year-old mother of one currently living in Chikomba West, Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer community health trainer striving to improve health and reduce poverty. Chipo also inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching students about their wellbeing, and as an entrepreneur. She is currently renting a table at the local flea market where she sells cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, and shoes. She started the business in 2013 in order to improve her standard of living.

Chipo will use the Kiva loan to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets, shirts, and shoes to increase her stock. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic accessories, jackets,shirts, and shoes to increase her stock

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is a 30-year-old widowed mother of two living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Tendai has the opportunity to work with schools in her community, helping students gain life and study skills. 

Over the last two years, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – she has 250 layers. She produces about 250 eggs every day and is selling them to local residents. She began the business when her family started facing financial difficulties. Since then, Tendai has managed to employ two people who were previously struggling to find work.

Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. Tendai would very much like to increase her production capacity. Therefore, she will use the Kiva loan to expand the fowl run in order to cater for more birds as well as to purchase more chick feed, layers concentrate and fencing to increase production. She hopes to put her two children through school.

loans.use: To expand the fowl run and purchase more birds and feeds.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 54 years old and a married woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Editha operates a grocery stall, selling vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She struggles with the high transportation cost of getting to the market each day, since she buys goods in large quantities. With the PHP 7,000 from this loan, she wants to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and mangoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nessie

texts.en:
Meet 21-year-old Nessie from Cabagan. She is married with one child. Two years ago, she established her retail business. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days a week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation problems.

Nessie requires a loan in order to purchase candies, milk, and drinks to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to become successful and increase her business. In the future, Nessie plans to open another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase candies, milk, and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more malarial drugs, pain tablets, blood syrup and cholera drugs to expand her business.

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.en:
This is Eriberta, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicanor, a construction worker and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Eriberta operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias and also a variety of hanging plants and others similar. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business.

Eriberta hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her family will have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business.

loans.name: Lindiwe

texts.en:
Lindiwe is a 19-year-old, single young woman living in Hurungwe, a district in Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools, teaching students about life skills. Lindiwe inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur. She currently operates a grocery shop where she sells items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, and matemba (sardines).

Lindiwe will use this Kiva loan to stock up on cooking oil, sugar, salt, mealie-meal, sugar beans, matemba (sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary to expand her business. She hopes to grow the business and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs and the needs of vulnerable children in the community.

loans.use: to increase her stock so that she can expand her business

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Tariro is married and a mother of one. She resides in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She inspires young women in her community both as a Camfed Learner Guide and as an entrepreneur, teaching life skills education and holding awareness campaigns to promote financial independence among women. She started her poultry business in January 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for chickens. Tariro currently produces about 100 chickens every six weeks and sells them to local customers.  

Tariro knows that she could sell more chickens each month, but because all her income is needed to provide for her child who is dependent upon her, she is unable to spend her current profits to expand her business. With this loan from Kiva, she will be able to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed. With a Kiva loan investment in her business, her profits will increase and she will be able to care for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is an 18-year-old business woman. She is single and lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. As a community volunteer, she disseminates health information to students in school. She currently operates a business selling new and second-hand clothes such as jackets, shirts and shoes at her local flea market. She started the business when she finished 10th grade. It enabled her to assist her family when they encountered financial difficulties.

Princess will use the Kiva loan to purchase a bale of clothes. This will boost her business tremendously and increase her clientele since purchasing a bale means she will have a variety of products to offer. She loves her business and dreams of opening a boutique. The business has enabled her to support her two-year-old child as well as her two cousins and two nieces. She intends to use the profits to pay for her dependents’ school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of clothes to increase sales at her flea market stall.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 22-year-old mother of one living in Hurungwe, Zimbabwe. For the past year, she has owned a small-scale plot where she farms Virginia tobacco. The business has enabled her to pull through financial hardships and support the local community by employing two workers.

A loan from Kiva will enable Abigail to improve production and increase her percentage yield by purchasing tobacco seeds and fertilizer in bulk to reduce shipping costs. An improvement in her business means she will be able to create employment in her community as well as improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to improve production, reduce shipping costs, and increase her yield by purchasing tobacco seeds and fertilizer in bulk

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Rosa continua dedicándose a la ganadería , producción y venta de leche, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra  de cuyes para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Rosa continues to raise livestock and producing and selling milk. She has been doing this for a long time and it brings her personal and financial satisfaction. At the same time she also continues to raise small animals. She wants to continue to work like this in order to support her family. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Monna

texts.en: Monna's determined is to finish her studies. GDMPC is helping her to succeed by providing student loans to deserving students. Her previous loan was used in paying school fees, charges and materials. She is taking this new loan to pay the school tuition fees for this current semester. She hopes to get a job after finishing her studies and to be able to help her parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the current semester.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a divorced woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, she has operated a fruit-and-vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, a 42-year-old, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Denmel, a tricycle driver and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.
She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.
Regina dreams of expanding her business and making it a big store. She hopes that all her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.
All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Lanchepata, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee seis reses de su propiedad, tiene sembrado tres Has de inverna donde cría su ganado, su esposa le apoya en esta labor elaborando artesanalmente quesillos, queso fresco, que lo comercializa en el mercado de su distrito son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan.

José Manuel, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de terneras para posteriormente aumentar la producción de ganado lechero, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of Lanchepata a rural area of the district of Santo Tomás located in the Province of Cutervo, Cajamarca Region in the north Andes of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raising cattle.

José Manuel raises and sells cattle. He has 6 cows on his property, three of them are pregnant. The cattle are raised on pastureland. His wife helps him in his work making homemade cheese and queso fresco (a soft mild unaged cheese) which they sell in the market of their district. They are a united family in the labor that they do together.


José Manuel is requesting a loan of 3,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy calves that will later augment his milk production and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy two calves to produce milk.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel tiene 27 años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece variedad de abarrotes arroz, aceite, azúcar, leche ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta amanera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Isabel, age 27, lives with her children in the Cayaltí district.  It is a community that devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is located in the Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque Región on the northern coast of Peru.

She has a little store where she sells a variety of groceries like rice, cooking oil, sugar, and milk.  She has requested a loan for 800 soles to buy a variety of products to offer to her customers.  This way she will generate greater profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, zinc, nails and a locker door.

loans.name: Ashlely

texts.en:
Ashley is a young, 24-year-old woman, married and living in Chikomba West District.  She is a CAMA member actively involved in empowering school leaders to reinvest into the community by carrying out health and education campaigns. She operates a small retail shop in her community where she sells a variety of grocery products such as soap, eggs, sugar, flour, milk, juice, and salt. The store is conveniently located since it is the only one in the vicinity. She started the business in 2012 when her husband lost his job and figured that she needed to do something and not wait for poverty to take toll. 

The Kiva loan will enable her to expand her business by increasing her stock and raise her sales. She sees herself being the leading supplier of grocery products in her village and also hopes to create employment in her community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, charcoal and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of electronics items like cables, lights, fans, plugs, bulbs, radios and switches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby food, dresses and baby cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en: Leonor is a farmer who is raising her family in a rural community. She is 24 years old and has one child. She has engaged in hog-raising to generate additional income. She plans to acquire more pigs to raise, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the needed feed and vitamins and to buy additional piglets to raise. She believes that his loan will make it possible for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets.

loans.name: Jacinta Mercedes

texts.es:
Jacinta de  48 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, están estudiando, es  originaria de Leon, lugar que está  ubicada en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracacteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libre le gusta de disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no estudio y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como es arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, fósforos, queso, hielo, avena. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo ofreciendo su producto para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Jacinta Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 48 years old, married and has two young children who attend school.  She is from Leon, which is located in the western part of the country and she is known for being a hardworking, responsible woman with a desire for personal success.  She likes to spend time with her children in her spare time.  Unfortunately she was not able to attend school because of lack of resources and had to go to work at an early age to help with the family expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has a small store where she sells food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, matches, cheese, ice, and oatmeal in small quantities.  She works 12 hours a day and will use the money from this loan as working capital so that she can have a greater income in the near future.  Jacinta Mercedes is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their help to people of scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, helping them find dignified means of work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: 02.06.5 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Thoa is applying for a loan to purchase material to make soup. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. Thoa has been involved in this business for 2 years. The main hardship that Thoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thoa is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province; she has another child who is grown up.

Thoa is the group leader of the 02.06.05 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. This is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

With her business profits, Thoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase material to make soup

loans.name: 03.05.06 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng has a retail business selling lagim. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry foods and general things such as eggs, candy, milk and noodles to resell. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hằng is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. 

Hằng is the group leader of the 03.05.05 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profits, Hằng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry foods and general things such as eggs, candy, milk, and noodles to resell.

loans.name: 03.05.05 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Loan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Loan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Loan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Loan is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. Loan lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Loan is the group leader of the 03.05.06 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Loan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profits, Loan hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella, 59, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Celso who works as a school guard and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bella operates a pineapple growing farm. She grows pineapple on their farm located in Cavite. It is in the high lands where it is suited to growing pineapple. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm.

Bella hopes that her farm will continue to flourish and dreams of always being in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that all her children will have a good future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Jay Ann

texts.en:
Jay Ann is 25 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail business with the help of her husband. She sells assorted kinds of fish to generate income and she also sells ready to wear clothes to earn additional income.
Jay Ann has four years’ experience in this field.
Jay Ann requested this loan to buy additional varieties of fish to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to continue providing her family.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari is 31 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store selling grocery items to her customers. She sells assorted goods and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a wiring installer.
Sari has two years’ experience in this field. Sari and her husband work hard in order to provide income for the family and to show her responsibility and love to serve not only her family but their community as well.
Sari requested this loan to purchase raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to continue assisting her family with the additional income. The couple wants to give their two children a better education.
The story of Sari and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC clients.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to make snacks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a divorced woman who has been blessed with seven children, all of whom are adults. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Chizi has operated a charcoal and a kerosene selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase charcoal and gallons of kerosene for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business,

loans.name: Ma Elida

texts.es:
Doña Ma Elida una señora de 34 años de edad, muy dedicada a su familia, casada y madre de 4 hijos quienes están pequeños. Junto a su esposo trabajan en la agricultura de forma propia sus cultivos de café los cuales están bien cuidados y muy bien ubicados a pocos metros de su casa de habitación lo cual pes permite trasladare a pie para darle la asistencia apropiada. Ella a muy temprana edad aprendió la caficultura gracias a sus padres quienes por generaciones han trabajado en el campo y pasaron sus conocimientos a ella así como la forma de cómo dar asistencia, aplicación de abono, etc. Ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que a muy temprana edad se dedicó a trabajar ya que los estudios no le gustaron y sus padres no tenían la facilidad para apoyarle económicamente.
Sus sueños son seguir cultivando y hacer crecer más sus cultivos de café, así generar más ingreso para su familia, estar en mejores condiciones de vida y hacer un esfuerzo por vivir mejor. Para con sus hijos darles todo lo necesario y siempre apoyándoles en sus estudios ya que como herencia es lo mejor. Doña Ma Elida necesita darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y esto lo lograra hacer mediante el apoyo financiero que hoy solicita de esta manera realizar la inversión necesaria en la compra de fertilizantes y abono cubriendo su necesidad y protegiendo sus cultivos para al final de la cosecha obtener un excelente grano.
texts.en:
Ma Elida is a 34 year old woman who is very dedicated to her family.  She is married and the mother of four small children.  She and her husband farm and raise coffee.  Her crops are well cared for and located a few meters from her house, so she can walk there.  She learned to raise coffee thanks to her parents.  The family has worked the fields for generations and passed their knowledge onto her, including how to apply fertilizer, etc.  She did not to go to school because she didn’t like to study and decided to go to work at an early age.

Her dreams are to continue farming and expanding her coffee crop to generate more income for her family, have a better quality of life, and make an effort to live better.  She wants to continue supporting her children and their education because inheritance it the best thing.  Ma Elida needs to maintain her coffee crops and will use this loan to buy fertilizer and compost.  This will cover her needs and protect her crops through the harvest to obtain an excellent grain.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias realiza el trabajo de puertas, garajes, ventas,etc. Pues requiere en la instalación de pernos de fijación, aparatos electrónicos o mecánicos distintos tipos de conocimientos y habilidades, reparar, cambiar, mantener cualquier tipo de cerraduras incluso con diseños elaborados al gusto del cliente.

Ella vive en casa propia, ubicada en El Alto. Necesita credito para comprar herramientas, necesita desesperadamente un arco, una prensa y una compresora, pues piensa hacer renovaciones para dar un mejor servicio 

El sueño de Elias  es abrir en un futuro ampliamente un taller de cerrajeria de alto renombre. Asi mejorar su calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Elias works installing doors, garages, windows etc. He has to install bolts, electronic and mechanical devices of different types and functions. He repairs, changes and does maintenance on any kind of lock including ones designed specifically for the client. Elias lives in his own house located in El Alto.

He needs a loan to buy tools. He desperately needs an arc welder, a press and a compressor as he is planning to do renovations to give better service. Elias' dream is to have a large well-known welding shop in the future. That would improve the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy tools (an arc welder, a press and a compressor).

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: La señora Olga quien es propietaria de una venta de tacos mejicanos,  Lleva trabajando un periodo de 7 años ella es madre 2 niñas las cuales aun estudian ya que el sueño y la meta de ella es que se  conviertan. en profesionales … ella durante la tarde y parte de la noche saca su negocio el cual es muy bien conocido dentro de la comunidad  cuenta con la ayuda de su papa y su hermana porque durante los fines de semana hay bastante demanda de sus clientes, tiene la oportunidad de comprar una carreta para chéveres ya que uno de sus sueños y metas es  poder crecer económicamente y con ello poder dar un mejor beneficio a su familia y un  buen aporte para su casa y familia  y es por eso que ella toca las puertas de kiva para obtener un crédito y no  quedarse allí si no crecer más  y poder convertirse en una microempresaria luchadora emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion de refacciones.
texts.en: Olga sells Mexican tacos and has been working at this for seven years.  She is the mother of two girls who attend school and her dream and goal is for them to become professionals.  She works her business in the evenings and part of the night and it’s very well known in the community.  Her father and sister help her because there is plenty of demand from her customers.  She has the opportunity to buy a cart and one of her dreams is to grow financially and provide a better benefit to her family and support her household well.  She came knocking on Kiva’s door to obtain a loan so she could grow and become a small entrepreneurial company with a desire to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to make refreshments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Solidario San Cristobal Group

texts.es: Solidario San Cristobal, este grupo lo integra la señora Ana Lilian de 40 años de edad, ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles desde hace 3 años,ella vende toda clase de mercaderia como verduras, frijos,fideos,aceite,etc, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas productos comestibles, ya que el anhelo de ella es agrandar un poco mas su tienda y mejorar sus ganancia ya que por medio de ello a podido ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The “Solidario San Cristobal” group includes Ana Lilian.  She is 40 years old and has had a food store for three years.  She sells all sorts of items such as vegetables, beans, noodles, cooking oil, etc.  She is asking for this loan to buy more products, since her goal is to grow her store a bit and improve her earnings so she can help her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma grows and harvests rice, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works in a private company as an inspector, since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she has to oversee her tenants as well as her crops.

Thelma is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs harvest improvement. In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have, since today people who are better prepared academically are able to get better jobs. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of this loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to increase her harvest.

loans.name: Xerica Jin

texts.en:
Xerica Jin was a child of a hardworking parents who wanted success for their children. Her father works as a cook and her mother as a housemaid. Their little income was perfectly divided with household expenses and school needs. Xerica Jin is now at university, studying BS Information Technology.  

Xerica Jin has two siblings and she is someone who is very dedicated to her studies and the love of her family. 

She is requesting this loan to pay school tuition fees. Her goal is to acquire a job and encourage her siblings to continue studying so that they both prepare themselves and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 51, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ordialyn, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Avelina owns and oversees operations of their jeepney* transportation business. She has one jeepney (14-16 person capacity), which earns boundary** (daily quota) payments each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP every day.
				
To help her continue operating their business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and maintenance for her jeepney unit.

Avelina hopes to buy another jeepney unit and dreams that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


*Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that truly makes the Philippines the Philippines.

**In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary” minus what he paid for the gas and oil is his take-home pay.

*** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 36 years of age and married. She has been running her retail business and variety store for almost 2 years. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000  PHP to purchase dresses, shoes, cosmetics, and groceries for her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to further improve her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, shoes, cosmetics, and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
This is Bernadette, a 58-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rafael and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Bernadette maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products by the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Bernadette hopes to expand her business and to become a distributor. She dreams of becoming rich. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Mujeni

texts.en:
Mujeni participates in the marketing function of Juhudi Kilimo, an agricultural micro-finance social enterprise, based in Kenya. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to pursue her Masters in Business Administration. The reason she is seeking a loan to finance her MBA is because her income is stretched, being the sole bread winner in her family.  Her husband’s travel business was adversely affected by Kenya’s post-election violence in 2007/2008.  She is taking care of family expenses including education for her two children.

Mujeni's father passed away when she was in secondary school, leaving her mother with 7 siblings, 6 other children that were passed onto her family through inheritance, and 1 adopted child.  Her mother could hardly afford to pay her fees. One of her siblings was moved with compassion and he forfeited his university education and settled for a low income job in order to raise school fees for Mujeni. This motivated her to work very hard, efforts that enabled her to join Kenyatta University where she completed her undergraduate degree, majoring in French, Education, and Business Studies. Her knowledge of French earned her a Bilingual Executive Assistant role in an organization.  Her manager quickly noticed her passion, diligence and willingness to learn more and gave her additional responsibilities in marketing.  She developed a strong interest in marketing and decided to enroll for a diploma in marketing.  She grew within the ranks of her profession from an Advertising Assistant, to Marketing Assistant, to a Brand Manager and later on, she was promoted to a Senior Brand Manager handling six countries. As her career grew, she also wanted to give back to her family and opted to use her earnings to educate three of her siblings. 

Having worked in the corporate world all her life, Mujeni longed to work for a social enterprise that is customer-centric and has social impact.  In June 2013, she was privileged to join the beautiful family of dedicated, passionate individuals at Juhudi Kilimo. She was attracted to Juhudi Kilimo because of the core business and operating model. Juhudi serves the poor, small holder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets that earn money for them and can be insured against loss. She loves the fact that Juhudi loans increase the income of the farmers so they can move from subsistence to more commercial farming, enhancing their own food security and that of their community.  She is excited to be part of an organization that provides a growth path for individuals to a more secure future.  She love challenge and joining Juhudi was an exciting opportunity for her because they did not have a marketing function and this was a great opportunity for her to set up the function as well as define and grow the Juhudi Brand.

Juhudi is undergoing a radical transformation. As part of the leadership team, she believe that she should lead by example.  She would like to improve her skills so that she can best partner with Juhudi to deliver the promise of elevating the quality of lives of Juhudi's farmers. As an executive heading the marketing function, she has decided to pursue the Global Executive MBA from USIU in Nairobi. This is an all-inclusive, practical course that will build her skills and make her a well-rounded leader.  She looks forward to applying the newly acquired skills and knowledge into her role in order to bring Juhudi to the next level.

loans.use: to pay for Masters in Business Administration costs

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She is a married woman with five children, three school-going and two underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Gladys has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Blanca Norena

texts.es:
Blanca de 33 años de edad, es una joven con mucha iniciativa, ha tenido que superar grandes dificultades, para ver crecer a sus tres hijas, que significan todo para ella. Estudio bachillerato, pero al salir embarazada tuvo que dejar los estudios, aun así, decidió capacitarse en cosmetología y es esta actividad la que le da el sustento en la actualidad. Siendo una madre soltera ha podido salir adelante y procurado que sus niñas puedan estudiar. Además de sus tres niñas, con ella viven su hermana y sobrino.

Blanca administra su sala de belleza, realiza esta actividad desde hace 7 años, se capacito por un año, además de atender el local, que se encuentra en su casa., brinda su servicio a domicilio, tiene clientes ya establecidos y va casa por casa ofreciendo el servicio. En el salón le ayuda su hermana y atienden el negocio de lunes a domingo. 


Utilizará el crédito en la compra de productos como tintes, solventes, extensiones, entre otros.  Además, necesita renovar algún equipo le se encuentra en mal estado, como máquina de corte de cabello, compra una vitrina. Teniendo la posibilidad de adquirir estos productos y equipo, podrá brindar un mejor servicio, tendrá surtido de productos y así tener más afluencia de clientes lo cual se reflejara en mayores ingresos.

Su sueño es poder fortalecer su negocio, generando oportunidades de trabajo a otras mujeres que lo necesiten. Además, poder transmitir  sus conocimientos de cosmetología a otras jóvenes que lo deseen.
texts.en:
Blanca is 33 years old and is a young lady with lots of initiative.  She has had to overcome great difficulties to see her three children grow.  They are everything to her.  She started going to school, but then got pregnant and had to leave, so she decided to train as a cosmetologist and she earns a living this way.  She has been able to get ahead as a single mom, making sure that her children can go to school.  Besides her three daughters, she lives with her sister and nephew.

Blanca has been running a beauty salon for seven years and trained for a year and besides tending to her home-based shop she also provides home based service.  She has steady customers and her sister helps her serve customers Monday through Sunday. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as tints, solvents, extensions, and other things.  She also needs to renovate some equipment that’s in bad shape, such as hair clippers and will also buy a display case.  She will be able to provide better service with these items and have more customers and greater income. 

Her dream is to be able to strengthen her business, generating work opportunities for other women who need them.  She will also be able to teach other young women about cosmetology.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wax cotton, uniforms, and ladies's dresses for resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is 48 years old and is now a widow. She was blessed with one child. Due to the hardship of living, she operates a small variety store in their village to generate income for their needs. She aspires to add to her products offered in order to increase her profit, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for additional business capital of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, and breads to sell. She hopes that her loan will be granted in order for her to make further enhancements to her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, and breads

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: In an effort to increase his sales, Nestor seeks the opportunity to access a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase more chicken so that he can produce more fried chicken for sale. He hopes to attract more customers by providing them with more products of greater quality. By earning more income, his family will enjoy a better quality of life. He will also be able to continue to save for the future of their child. Hopefully, his requested loan will be approved.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en: Minerva, age 33, is operating sari-sari store and earning about 400 PHP every day. Her net income is usually saved for their daily consumption and for her business as well. Now, she would like to increase her daily income. With this in mind, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, assorted candies and spices. She knows that with these goods she will able to increase her typical income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, assorted candies and spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and coal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epifania grows and harvests rice, work that she has done after she became a widow. She solely provides for her family from her earnings.  She gets up early and has to go to her farm where she oversees her crops. 

Epifania is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement.  In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to have a better living with her family. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of GDMPC micro loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ernestina,  la socia continua dedicándose a la  Ganadería, en la producción y venta de  lácteos, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia produce  leche, queso y yogurt, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche para su negocio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Ernestina continues raising livestock, buying and selling dairy and has been doing this for many years.  Things are going well for her thanks to her dedication.  She produces milk, cheese, and yogurt and is a responsible and enterprising woman who gets her family ahead in this manner.

She is asking for this loan to buy milk for her business.

She is grateful to Kiva for helping her develop her business and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald, 20 years old, is married with one child. He has been engaged in farming business for two years. In his area, he is a very hardworking person. He does everything just to sustain the needs of his family. Gerald is asking for a loan amount of PHP 7,000 to buy wood, nails, and wood glue for his furniture business. 

In the future, Gerald hopes that he can build his own house to give a better quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails and wood glue for his furniture business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 38 years old.  He is married and has two children. He lives in La Libertad, Zamboanga del Norte. He engages in a spare parts business for motorcycles and multicabs.  He has a monthly income of Php 20,000 doing this type of work. He joined in Paglaum last year and applied for a loan to purchase motorcycle and multicab spare parts to sell.  The profit he earns in his business can support the education of his children.

loans.use: purchase spare parts for motorcycle and multicab

loans.name: Sonia Elvira

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad conocida por la Capital del Tondero, un baile típico de su distrito, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, juguetes en el mercado de su distrito, dedicándose a este rubro desde hace 15 años, Sonia es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de juguetes para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Morropon district, a community known as the Capital of the Tondero, a typical dance among the population who are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located in the Piura Region on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells fruits and toys in the local market and has done this for 15 years.  Sonia is an enterprising mother and has requested a loan of 3,500 Nuevos Soles, through Edpyme Alternativa, to buy a variety of toys to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay is a 42-year-old father, who is raising his family in a rural community. He aimed to improve their status in order to educate his two children and to give them a better living. Aside from farming, he also engages in the hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. He planned to acquire more pigs to raise, but he has limited capital. For this reason, he is seeking a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Through this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Gaby Lisset

texts.es:
Gaby Lisset tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto esposo e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes, cerdos, desde hace más de 5 años, cuenta con clientela en su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gaby Lisset is 25 years old and lives with her husband in the Oyotun district, a community made up of farmers, merchants, and livestock raisers.  It’s located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells animals like ducks, roosters, chickens, Guinea pigs, pigs, and has done so for five years.  She has customers in her district and is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy balanced fees and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Rosalida

texts.es:
Rosalida tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío La Unión, una zona rural del distrito de Zaña una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno lechero desde hace más de 5 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca lechera y alimentos balanceados y de esta manera tener una mayor producción de leche para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosalida is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children in the La Union settlement, a community located in the Zaña district, made up of farmers, merchants, and livestock raisers.  It’s located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells dairy cows and has for five years.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Nuevos Soles to buy a dairy cow and balanced feed to increase her milk production for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 56, a resident of Baccor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arturo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells rice for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Teresita dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina belongs to a poor family. She is living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows which are usable in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld broken accessories.

A few days ago his welding plant became out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant but he does not have cash in hand due to a lot of household expenses.

Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan from BRAC, who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

Zarina thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a welding plant to weld iron accessories.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married woman with three children, two in school and one underage. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Uchi sells goat meat at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is an IT Manager at Juhudi Kilimo, an agricultural microfinance institution in Kenya, East Africa. He is requesting a loan form Kiva to pursue his undergraduate studies in Business Information Technology. He wants to pursue his degree because of his desire to keep abreast with emerging technological trends in the Information Communication Technology (ICT) sector. 

The reason he is seeking a loan to finance his studies is that his father is diabetic with high blood pressure and thus on full time medication, which he and his siblings pay for. He also has a wife who is unemployed and a son to care for. These family responsibilities reduce his income, and high interest rates make a loan in Kenya for his pursuit of higher education, prohibitive. A Kiva loan for his education will afford him the chance to keep learning and assisting in Juhudi's growth.

Job joined Juhudi Kilimo in April 2010 as a Systems Administrator and he is one of three people who has been with the company from the start! Previously he was an IT Support Assistant with the K-Rep Development Agency. He had had internship experience before that, with AMTECH Technologies, Swedish Co-operative Centre –VI Agro forestry, and the Agricultural Development Corporation. 

He is passionate about Juhudi because of the innovative environment and also because the management and board are receptive to embracing emerging technological systems. He has been instrumental regarding systems support in the Juhudi offices and has played a significant role in systems upgrades. This includes the facilitation of continuous integration and maintenance of all business application systems like ERP, CRM, Cloud application systems, mobile phone application systems and other IT interventions. IT has been changing in Kenya – recently Juhudi migrated to a microfinance platform on SalesForce which will allow it to grow its portfolio of agriculture, livestock and transportation loans. 

Job's degree will give him the skills to provide ICT solutions for Juhudi's services as the company grows in the coming years, and will cascade to operational aspects of IT management.

loans.use: to help cover costs for a degree in Business Information Technology

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is  42 years old. Her husband, who earns a low income, constructs sheltering products for houses under construction. Most of his work depends upon infrequent contracts.

Recently Bushra's husband received a huge contract, but he lacks sufficient material to provide proper services. She is therefore requesting a loan so her husband can buy more planks, iron sheets and bamboo to provide his best services. 

Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan, and is hopeful of support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy sheltering materials such as planks, iron sheets and  bamboo

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es:
Karla María tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad de bazar y regalos desde hace más de 8 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Karla María is 34 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Cayalti district, a community located in the Chiclayo province, made up of farmers, merchants, and livestock raisers.  It’s located in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells personal products, sundries, and gifts and has for more than eight years.  She is asking for a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles to buy a variety of products to offer her customers and increase her family income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en: Luzvilla is 63 years old, married, and has four adult children. She lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She has engaged in snack vending for three years, with a monthly income of Php 3000. She has been a borrower of PMPC for three years with good credit standing. She joined in Paglaum nine years ago.  She applied for a loan to purchase flour, and white and brown sugar for retail. The profit she earns from this business will be used for daily needs and personal savings for her retirement.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar

loans.name: Talat

texts.en:
Talat is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her two sons and daughter study. Her husband has been running his own clothes selling business for five years.  He is the one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Talat is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband with purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Talat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy different types of clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Amber

texts.en:
Amber is a 30-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children and husband.  Her husband runs his own electronics and sound system shop.  He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of his family.

Amber's husband wants to purchase different types of accessories and merchandise, e.g. wires, speakers, etc., for his business, but due to financial constraints he is not in a condition to buy them. Therefore, Amber has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help from this loan, she will enable her husband to buy the above merchandise for his business so that he can earn a more profitable income.

Amber is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy some wires, speakers and other accessories for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: Monsieur Alassane est un homme agé de 55 ans qui évolue dans la commercialisation du pain. Il est marié et père de 11 enfants dont le plus agé à 24 ans et le plus petit 2 ans. Il sollicite ce crédit d’un montant de 500.000F pour acheter de la farine et fabriquer du pain qu’il vend dans le marché de sa commune. Alassane commence sa journée à  3h du matin pour la terminer à 11h. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  A l’avenir, il voudrait ouvrir une ferme agricole pour augmenter ses revenus et diversifier ses activités  afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Alassane is a 55-year-old man who got started in the marketing of bread. He is married and the father of eleven children, of which the oldest is 24 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. He is asking for a loan of 500,000 F to purchase flour and make bread, which he sells in the market of his town. Alassane starts his day at 3 in the morning and finishes at 11. He takes care of the daily needs of his family and his children's school fees. In the future, he would like to open a farm to increase his revenues and diversify his business in order to be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase flour for the production of bread, which he sells to his clients.

loans.name: Rabiyatou Ndiaye

texts.fr: Madame Rabiyatou est une promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 2ans dans  cette activité.
