Rabiyatou a 53ans, mariée et mère de 6 ans dont le plus âgé a 30 ans et le plus petit 3 ans. Elle demande ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000 F pour acheter des fruits et légumes destinées  à la vente. Elle possède une étale sur le marché de la commune et y viens le matin à 8h pour rentrer vers les coûts de 11h 30mn. A l’avenir ; elle souhaite augmenter et diversifier son stock de marchandises  pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. Elle a comme charges particulières les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Rabiyatou a choisi ce métier par amour.
texts.en: Rabiyatou is a retailer who works in the fruit and vegetables business. She has experience of over 2 years in this business. Rabiyatou is 53 years old, and the mother of 6 - the eldest is 30 and the youngest is 3 years. She requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 XOF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. She has a display in the market of the town and arrives in the morning at 8am and sells until 11:30. In the future, she hopes to increase and diversify her inventory of goods in order to satisfy her customers. She takes care of the daily expenses of her family. Rabiyatou chose this profession by love.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dado Pithiel

texts.fr: Madame Dado Pithiel  est une promotrice qui évolue dans la vente des fruits et légumes. Elle est âgée de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont le plus agé a 35 ans et le plus petit 08 ans. Dado a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité et demande ce montant pour augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. Ayant de grands enfants  ne lui empêche pas de soutenir son mari et de l’aider sur les charges familiales. Elle commence sa journée à 09h pour la terminer à 14h. A l’avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une ferme agricole avec l’aide de l’institution ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en:
Ms. Dado Pithiel is a promoter who sells fruit and vegetables. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of nine children, of whom the eldest is 35 and the youngest eight years old.

Dado has an experience of over 20 years in the business and is requesting this loan amount to increase her stock of goods so she can satisfy her customers. Having older children does not prevent her to support her husband and help him deal with family expenses. She begins her workday at 9 am and finishes at 2 pm.

In the future she would like to start a farm with the help of the institution, so she can increase her income and put money into savings.

loans.use: Buy and sell fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr: Aïssata est une femme promotrice âgée de 41 ans qui fait de l’embouche. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont le plus grand a 17 et le plus petit 5 mois. Elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans cette activité. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais scolaires des enfants. Elle demande ce montant pour augmenter et diversifier son cheptel. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour revenir à la maison le soir vers les coûts de 19h. Elle achète des moutons et chèvres qu’elle engraisse et ensuite les revend. Durant ses heures libres elle fait de la broderie des drap. A l’avenir elle souhaite avec le soutien de l’institution ouvrir une ferme d’élevage pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et améliorer sa condition de vivre.
texts.en:
Aïssata is 41 years old, married and has five children, the eldest is seventeen years old and the youngest is five months old.  She raises livestock, and has ten years' experience in this business.  She helps her husband to provide for the day-to-day needs of their family, and the school fees of their children.

Aïssata has requested this loan in order to increase the number of animals that she has.  She starts her working day at seven in the morning, and returns home at seven in the evening.  She buys sheep and goats, fattens them up and then resells them.

In her spare time, Aïssata embroiders sheets.

In the future, Aïssata would like to continue working with the field partner and open a farm to raise livestock.  In this way she would be able to provide for the needs of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to raise and then resell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe TIESSIRI ont en moyenne  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KARANTELA  dans La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de condiments et articles divers. 
Après avoir remboursés correctement leur prêt précédent, les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. NANA, 1ère femme à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 25Kgs de Sel de cuisine ,50Kgs d’ognon, 10 paquets de cube Maggi et 15 litres d’huile. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22. 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
On average, the women of the Tiessiri group are 41 years old, have five children, and all live in extended traditional families in Karantela - in the city of San/Segou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another through relatives and neighbors. They buy and sell condiments and miscellaneous items.  After having properly repaid their previous loan, the women in the Tiessiri group are on their second group loan. 

Nana, the woman pictured at left, plans on using her loan to buy 25 kgs of cooking salt, 50 kgs of onions, 10 packets of Maggi cubes, and 15 liters of oil. She buys her supplies from wholesalers and sells her goods to men and women for cash, and often for credit. 

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 22,000 FCFA that she’ll use for expenses related to health, food, clothing, and schooling. The rest will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: Achat de condiments

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en: As the married parent of one child, Anabel works hard to support her family. She earns a living by buying and selling firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by selling fish.  She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell to her customers. Anabel has sustained her business with help from three prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and has one child.  She operates a retail business, while her husband works as a driver to earn a living. For three years selling cosmetic products in their village, it has helped a lot to support her husband’s income for the family. She has sustained her business and was able to engage in selling coconuts in the area. Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy additional cosmetic products to sell. In the future, Cecilia wants to expand her business to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her seven children. Her husband has been working as motor mechanic for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Nasreen also provides sewing services and earns income to contribute, along with her husband, to manage the needs of the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some products for her business such as clothes, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Shazia also provides sewing services and earns income to contribute, along with her husband, to the management of the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some products for her business use such as clothes, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Fazal's Group

texts.en: Fazal, age 34, is a mother of three children. She owns an embroidery business, which is the only source of income for the family. She needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery materials. This would help her to offer more variety to her customers, and to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money she finds it difficult. For that, Fazal is requesting a group loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping herself.  She will purchase an embroidery machine, and a new variety of embroidery materials. Fazal is feeling happy that she will be able to help herself with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and embroidery accessories for her business.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a 52-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son is a confectioner by profession.  He owns a bakery in his hometown. He sells different kinds of sweets such as laddu, barfi, gulabjamun, rus gullay, etc. Her husband used to run the bakery, but due to his old age her son has taken over from her husband and now looks after all the bakery's affairs. He has been purchasing all the inventory in large quantity from nearby bakeries and sells it from his own bakery.  Now he wants to prepare all the sweets by himself at home, but he does not have the basic ingredients for making sweets. Due to the lack of availability of funds, he is unable to buy the raw materials needed for making sweets.

Therefore, Jameela has requested a loan so that her son can buy his desired ingredients for making sweets to sell. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her son buy wheat flour, sugar and oil for making sweets to sell.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en: Arlinda is 49 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell to her customers. Arlinda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, snack foods and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Téning

texts.fr:
Madame Téning est une femme très active qui évolue dans la vente de céréales. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine.  Elle se lève à 6h du matin et travaille jusqu’à 14heures de l’après-midi. Elle achète les céréales à des prix très abordables, qu’elle stocke pendant des mois et qu’elle vendra lors de la période de crise : son bénéfice peut donc doubler ou même tripler.
Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle soutient son mari et s’occupe de l’éducation de ses enfants, payer leur frais de scolarité et améliorer les conditions alimentaires. Car son souci majeur est de s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Téning is a very active women who works selling cereals. She has more than five years' experience in this area. She wakes up at 6 a.m. and works until 2 p.m. in the afternoon. 

Téning buys cereals when they are at a good price. Then she stores them for some months until she can sell them at a higher price. This allows her double or even triple her earnings, which she uses to support her husband in covering their children's education and school fees and improving the family's diet.

Téning's main concern is taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals, such as millet, corn, groundnuts, to resell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a single entrepreneur who runs an auto repair shop in her village. For more than eight years, she has earned well and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her shop. She had her workers hep her with her business. To improve the services, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional spare parts and tires used for repair services.  She wants to have a comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and tires

loans.name: Noel

texts.en: Noel is 55 years old and lives in Bangkal, Ozamis City. He is married, has two children and earns a living by running a small grocery store and barber shop. He makes about PHP 8,000 each month and has requested a loan to buy additional groceries to sell.  Noel has been a member of PMPC for four years and hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to earn additional income in his store and barber shop.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and lives in Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is a widow. Arlene is engaged in a mini-grocery business and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. 

Arlene has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional stock for her mini-grocery store. She has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her living conditions, continue to support the education of her children, and meet the daily basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her mini-grocery store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been generating income from her fruit salad making in their village while her husband does fishing. For many years, the improving taste of her salad was fortunately in demand by her costumers. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for her business. 

To cater to demands and orders, she needs to have more capital. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro loans to buy raw ingredients to prepare salad to sell.

She hopes to expand and improve her business to have better living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare salad for sale

loans.name: Jermie

texts.en: Jermie  is single and an entrepreneur who earns a living by running a transportation business. He has been in this line of work for a year and is happy to say that it is really helping him to meet his needs. He is requesting a loan from GDMPC microfinance to buy new tires to replace old ones on his vehicle. In the future, he wants to improve his service as a way to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Marites has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Pablita has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cresil

texts.en:
Cresil is a 32-year-old married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cresil has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Cresil requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like cooking oil, noodles, beers, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like cooking oil, noodles, beers, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 36-year-old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working for Toyota as a driver for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of  the family. Musarat is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute, along with her husband, to the management of the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purposes. However, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan, from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some products for her business such as cloths, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is the responsible mother of three sons and five daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs maintenance to his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make the repairs on his taxi. Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Nasreen's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Nasreen also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Nasreen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to make repairs on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is the responsible mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport service, by driving a taxi, for two years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs on his taxi, because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make repairs on his taxi. Therefore Amina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Amina's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Amina also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Amina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Hanufa

texts.en:
Hanufa is a 29-year-old married woman, and her husband is 44 years old. By occupation, her husband is a farmer. Hanufa has two children; one goes to school, and the other is too small to go to school. Hanufa lives in a small town, Dhupguri, of Jalpaiguri District. 

Her husband is a farmer by profession, but his income is too low to bear the family’s expenses. Thus, Hanufa plans to do cultivation of potatoes and decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can start her own business. She has taken the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation. She has decided to grow potatoes, as potatoes are a crop very much in demand in their area. She hopes she can generate more income through this harvest.

She hopes that it will be possible for her to purchase a mini-tractor for her agricultural use with the profit from her potato business. She will sell potatoes in the local village market. 

Now, Hanufa is running her business successfully, and she is thanking both BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 34-year-old married woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children, and her husband is a vehicle repair mechanic by profession. Her husband  provides services to people in the market, in the form of repairing vehicles. He has also spare parts in the workshop for resale. He needs to purchase some spare parts for his shop. This will help him to continue his work. 

Mumtaz's husband does not have enough funds to purchase the parts he needs. Therefore, Mumtaz is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy spare parts for resale such as tyres, tubes, axles, and brake shoes. Mumtaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Reendoube Mijo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement  reendoube Mijo est composé de 5 personnes qui sont des parents. Leur présidente s’appelle Houleye, on le reconnait par la main levée sur la photo. Elle est âgée de 34ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont le plus grand a 14 ans et le plus petit a 1ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce et a une expérience de plus de 4ans. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre du charbon de bois très prisé dans cette localité. Elle aide son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir elle voudrait augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: The members of the Reeendoube Mijo is composed of five individuals who are related. Their leader’s name is Houleye. She can be recognized as the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of five children. The eldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is one year old. She has over four years of experience working as a vendor. She starts her work day at 8 AM in order to finish at 7 PM. She is seeking this funds to buy and resell charcoal, very much in demand in their area. She helps her husband cover everyday household expenses and school fees for their children. In the future she would like to enlarge her stock in order to be able to increase her revenues and improve her family’s life conditions.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dan Dolle Group

texts.fr: DAN DOLLE est un groupement d’intérêt économique qui est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et fond ensemble la même activité. Leur présidente s’appelle Khady, c’est elle qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle est marié et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans son activité et commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 19h. Son activité consiste à acheter des caisses de poissons frais sur le quai de sa commune et ensuite les amener au marché et les vendre aux ménagères. Ainsi elle sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son fond de roulement et  diversifier ses produits de mer et augmenter la qualité afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. A l’avenir elle voudrait vivre dans le confort et avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en: Dan Dolle is an economic interest group composed of 10 people. They live in the same neighborhood and work together. Khady, the group's president, has her hand raised in the photo. She is a married mother who helps her husband manage their family's daily expenses. She has more than 5 years of business experience, starting her day at 9am and finishing at 7pm. Her business is to buy crates of fresh fish on the dock of her town and then bring them to the market to sell to housewives. She will use this loan to grow her working capital, diversify her stock of seafood, and increase its quality to better satisfy her customers. In the future, she would like to live comfortably and be financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase crates of fresh fish for reselling

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Nellie is 54 years old, and married with two children. She presently resides in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga.  She has been engaged in a sari-sari store for ten years, with a monthly income of 3,000 doing this type of work.  She joined Paglaum in 2010 and she has applied for a loan to purchase stocks for her sari-sari store. The profits she earns from her business are used for their daily consumption and daily expenses of her student.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her sari-sari store.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 54 years old and married with three children. 

Lolita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been in pig fattening for 35 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norcaya

texts.en:
Norcaya is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 39-years-old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional jewelry to sell.

Norcaya has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is 50 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Paula has a buy and sell rice grain business in the Philippines. Paula requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers.

Paula has been in this business for 10 years. Paula would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria is 53 years old, and has five children who are currently in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Victoria requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Victoria has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is taking a loan to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery work at home. She has been doing embroidery for many years and feeding her children. Naseem is 54 years old and the mother of six children. Her husband works at a small firm for very low daily wages and comes home very late at night. Naseem has to manage routine work and complete her tasks related to embroidery, as well. 

Due to demand, Naseem is facing a shortage of material and is unable to do her fine embroidery. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can reduce the shortage of raw materials for embroidery. With this loan, she will buy stocks of thread, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Naseem is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sequins, pearls, and various color threads for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 42 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming nipa palms in the Philippines. Elsie has been farming nipa for seven years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elsie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 49-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four daughters and two sons. She requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. Her husband owns a fruit shop and participates in household expenses. He likes to sell seasonal fruits. Now he wants to buy bananas in large quantity to sell because its season is going on and its price is very low.

Therefore, Kousar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can buy bananas in bulk. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale

loans.name: Zaree

texts.en: Zaree is 39 years old, married and lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three children, and her husband is a very hardworking and honest person. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers many types of delicious foods. His customers have suggested that he begin selling milk because no other place nearby sells it. He does not have enough cash on hand to do this, so his wife is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to make this possible. She offers thanks to all Kiva lenders for their warmth and support for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell in a restaurant.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 50; her husband has grown old and stays at home. She is the mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Razia sews the bags along with her sons and two daughters at home to feed her family. She has two sewing machines for sewing school and hand bags, which are done by her daughters. Her sons deal with outside customers, taking orders from them and sewing the bags to order.

Razia wants to buy an additional sewing machine for sewing bags, but does not have enough cash on hand. Therefore, Razia has requested a Kiva loan through field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a sewing machine and additional raw materials such as rexine, zippers, buckles, etc for sewing bags.

Her desire is to sell her bags directly in the market, so that she can get a maximum reward against mutual efforts. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing bags.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta owns a farm and a general store. She works hard to earn income for the family. For more than 21 years in the retail business, she has earned well and has successfully repaid her previous loan used as additional capital in her retail store. Currently, she needs to purchase fertilizer to help improve the farm. This current loan will help her to earn more from her farm. She hopes to have a better source of income for the family needs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, greengrams, and groundnuts

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick lives and farms in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya, an area with high poultry farming.  He has been farming for five years.  His primary income comes from the sale of milk, eggs, poultry and maize.  He has a motorbike which he uses for his transportation business.  With farming, he enjoys dairy and poultry farming.  His biggest challenge is diseases affecting the poultry.

Fredrick chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have enabled him to improve his farming and life.  Also, its loans are short term and have low interest rates.  He says that out of this loan, he will be able to educate his siblings.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide is a well-established farmer living in the Kitale area of the Northern rift in Kenya where there is a lot of maize production. She is married and has seven children, all of whom are of school-going age. Adelaide enjoys poultry farming the most, but her biggest challenge is poultry diseases.

Adelaide chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because Juhudi finances farmers and she is a poultry farmer who wants to improve her poultry farming project. Juhudi Kilimo also gives short term loans with low interest rates. This loan will enable Adelaide to provide for the needs of her family and also to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is aged 43, and she is the mother of three children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother she wants to provide better facilities for her children; this is the reason she is doing extraordinarily hard work to keep her children smiling.

Abida has been sewing clothes since the birth of her two children, when she observed that her husband failed to provide all the necessities for her children. Then she decided to start tailoring at home and till now she has sewn the clothes in her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wishes to buy a juki machine. Professional persons use this machine for tailoring because it’s faster and its work is very fine.

Abida knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbours, relatives and the local community persons. She has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. Abida is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons for tailoring

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bags of beans and ten bags of maize.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Samina purchases cloth at cheap rates and sews garments that her husband sells at the market. She does not have any other source of income, and she does her tailoring business at home. She has been doing this work for many years and now she has gotten enough experience that she knows cloth dealing very well.

Samina's sewing machine suddenly stopped working and she is unable to sew garments. She wants to buy a new sewing machine, but is unable to do so due to financial constraints. This is the reason she has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. Samina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing garments to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Nisi Group

texts.es: Dúo nissi conformado por la señor señor Darvin Quien es propietario de una librería ubicada en ciudad peronia ya  hace algunos años que la apertura y menciona el señor yonathan que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio tiene variedad de productos de librería y y regalitos para toda ocasión  es papa soltero y tiene a su cargo un hijo el cual estudia ya que las metas del señor Jonathan son de que su hijo se convierta en una persona profesional en esta ocasión el hace de la solicitud de ustedes un crédito para la inversión de su librería ya que por las fechas de inicio de clases es un buena temporada para invertir y vender y agradece que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud.
texts.en: Darvin is a member of Dúo Nisi. He has owned a paper goods store in Ciudad Peronia for several years and says that has business is going well. He carries a variety of office supplies and small gifts for every occasion. He is a single father and takes care of his son, who is in school. He wants his son to have a good career. He is requesting this loan to invest it in his shop because the beginning of the school year is a good time for his business. He is grateful to you for considering helping him.

loans.use: to buy products for his bookstore.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Eusebia, la socia continua con su negocio de  ganadería principalmente a la crianza de ganado vacuno, la socia cría estos animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez continua dedicándose a la  agricultura produciendo productos como papa, habas y maíz, la socia es una persona  responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca para su negocio.

La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Eusebia still has a business raising livestock, especially cows. She raises the animals and then sells them to her customers. She is also still farming, growing crops such as potatoes, beans, and corn. She is a responsible, hardworking person who wants to keep working to support her family. She is requesting this loan so she can buy a cow for her business.

She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments in full.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her business.

loans.name: Remielyne

texts.en: Remielyn is a hardworking mother, who is aiming for a happy and successful life. She is 36 years old, and has only one child. She plans to improve her variety store and increase her product offerings, but she has insufficient capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to be able to buy more stocks of grocery items, fruits, and vegetables to resell in the local community. She hopes that her loan request will be granted in order for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Reynida

texts.en: Reynida is 55-years-old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the community and has asked for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns additional income from selling fish.  Reynida wants to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of noodles, drinks and spices for her store

loans.name: Marielyn

texts.en: Marielyn, a mother of two, prepares made to order foods in their community to make a living. Her husband works as driver, and she work with her business in order to gain more income for her children’s needs and better education. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for ingredients. Recently, she took a new loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for catering. She plans to build a shelter for her catering business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for catering.

loans.name: Hitler Eli

texts.es:
Hitler Eli tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el caserío de Viza, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad con paisajes verdes, un relieve accidentado que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, especialmente mediante el cultivo de café, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a prestar servicios de fabricación de diferentes trabajos de estructuras en madera puertas, ventanas, techos, desde hace 5 años, tiene una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una maquina cepilladora para la elaboración de diferentes trabajos en madera ya que en los últimos meses ha aumentado su clientela, ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hitler Eli is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Viza, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás. Its green landscapes make it perfect for agriculture, especially coffee growing, livestock, and commerce. The community is in the province of Cutervo, in the Cajamarca region in the mountainous north of Peru.

He makes a living offering a variety of construction services, building wooden structures, doors, windows, and roofs for the last five years. He has a very tight-knit family. He has requested a loan of 1,500 soles to buy a planer so he can complete a variety of carpentry jobs. His customer base has expanded in the past few months, and this would allow him to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a planer so he can complete a variety of carpentry jobs.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya with her husband and six children who are between the ages of one and sixteen years. She has been farming for the past 15 years with the primary source of income being milk, eggs, crops, transportation services and a retail business. In farming, she enjoys dairy farming the most. Her biggest challenges are diseases affecting both crops and livestock.

Stella chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer small-scale farmers short-term loans at a low interest rate. She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow and increase the milk production. This will enable her to pay for her children's school fees and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucia has been in this business for one year now.

Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marystellah

texts.en:
Marystella lives in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya with her husband and five children, all of whom are of school-going age.  She has been farming for 10 years, with her primary income source being milk, eggs, crops and a transportation service.  With farming, she enjoys dairy farming the most.  Her biggest challenge is diseases affecting her crops and livestock.

Marystella chose Juhudi Kilimo because its outreach in the area has enabled farmers to improve their farming activities, thus, their livelihood improves. This loan will enable her to purchase more poultry that will bring in more income to improve her family's living standards and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 42-years-old and has one child who is still in school.

Luzviminda has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with two children, one who is in school and one who is underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, Mejumaa has been operating a business that sells Leso cloth (women's wraps). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, Mejumaa wants to purchase pieces of Leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of Leso cloth (women's wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati and her husband, Haridhan, and their three children live in a small town, Dhupguri, in Jalpaiguri. She and her husband both are uneducated, but know how to sign their names. All the children are studying in different classes. 

Minati is a homemaker, but her husband is a mason. Her husband’s income is not sufficient for their family, so Minati decided to start her own business and help her husband financially. In her locality, the demand for milk is very high, so she decided to buy a cow and sell the milk in the market to make their family financially strong. 

Due to the lack of money, she was unable to purchase a cow and start her new business, so she applied for a loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner). 

In the future, she wants to build a farmhouse and give higher education to their children by making a good profit from this business.
 
She is very grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cow so she can sell milk in the market.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov (in photo), age 63, is a widow with one daughter. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. Her daughter is a garment factory worker. Pov’s business is in renting out a space in her house. Anyway, the house where she lives is breaking down in some parts and she wants to remodel it. Hence she decided to apply for a loan to use for that purpose!

loans.use: To remodel the house where she lives.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Bopha, aged 28, lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2012 and just has one young daughter. Bopha is a silk weaver, while her husband is a carpenter. She is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her family because they do not have one.

Photo: Bopha with her loom.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her family.

loans.name: Dúo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Dúo amanecer  conformado por la señora Elizabeth quien es propietaria de una tortillería anteriormente ella solicito un crédito en el cual cancelo de una manera correcta actualmente aparte de a tortillería se dedica a hacer tamales y paches y tambien vende ropa tipica y es madre de 3 hijos los cuales ha logrado sacar adelane a pesar de ser una madre soltera ella menciona que gracias a DIOS le ha ido muy bien en sus negocio y que desea crecer cada dia mas y esa es la razón por la cual ella toca nuevamente las puertas de fape para que se le otorgue un nuevo crédito para invertir en su tortillería en lo que son granos como maíz y poder tener para el consumo de su negocio, y tambien para la compra de ropa tipica.
texts.en: Elizabeth, one member of Dúo Amanecer, owns a little tortilla shop. She requested a previous loan, which she paid off promptly. Now, in addition to tortillas she also makes tamales and paches (similar to tamales but using potato instead of corn) and also sells clothing that is typical of the region. She is the mother of three children, whom she has supported and given a good life despite being a single mother. She says that it is thanks to God that she has been successful in her business and that she hopes to keep growing every day. That is why she is currently requesting another loan from FAPE to invest in her tortilla shop. She will buy corn and other products to use in her business, as well as typical clothing.

loans.use: to buy typical regional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Purreh

texts.en:
Purreh has been a widow for many years and she, alone, provides for her family. She sells food in her village while operating her own farm for a living. Purreh has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used in her food production business. She has had to increase her income to meet increasing family expenses.

Recently, Purreh took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, in order to boost her farm. In the future, she wants to live comfortably and ensure a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercy hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a happy family. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Junior Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de construcción civil en diversas obras construcción de viviendas, tarrajeo de paredes, colocación de falso piso entre otros, es conocido en su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales y herramientas de trabajo y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 19 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Zaña, a village near the valley of the Jequetepeque River. He and his neighbors make a living farming, raising livestock, and with small retail businesses. The village is in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of the northern Peruvian coast.

He works in construction on a variety of projects, including building homes, plastering walls, and installing floors. He is well known in his community. He has requested a loan of 1,000 soles to buy materials and tools so he can offer his customers better service.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and tools.

loans.name: Hubert

texts.es:
Hubert tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad con grandes depósitos de arena y ripio que su población utiliza para las construcciones, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque que pertenece a la costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una bodeguita donde ofrecer venta de abarrotes, desde hace más de 5 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hubert is 58 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Cayaltí, a village with large deposits of sand and gravel that the population uses in construction. The community makes its living in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He has had a little grocery store for more than five years. His wife helps him out in the shop. He has requested a loan of 1,000 soles to buy a variety of products to stock his shop and expand his business, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock his shop.

loans.name: Maria Haidee

texts.en:
Maria Haidee is 55-years-old and married with six children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Maria Haidee has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, coffee, juice, milk, laundry soap, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a married woman with four children. She is 50 years old and one of her children is still in school. Ludivina is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a sewing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years.

Ludivina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her sewing business

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is married with seven children; five are in school, and two are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanaisha operates a café business and makes consumables, such as rice, tea, beans and chapatti (flat bread), for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as a major challenge.

With the KES 70,000, she wants to purchase stock of beans, cooking oil and wheat flour for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of beans, cooking oil and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: María Licenia

texts.es: María es una mujer luchadora de 61 años de edad, ella tiene 8 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos viven con ella y su esposo  y también vive con 2 de sus nietos  de 15 y 11 años de edad los cuales se encuentran asistiendo al colegio. María comenta que juntamente con su esposo se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y que el crédito que le dio Fodemi lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, María agrega  que inicio su negocio desde  que era adolecente, pero que lo mejoró con el apoyo que le dio Fodemi desde hace 4 años atrás y hasta la actualidad le sigue ayudando.los sueños de María son seguir apoyando a sus nietos en lo que necesiten para que terminen de estudiar y le gustaría comprar más reses con las que pueda tener  una vida tranquila para sustentar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: María is a hardworking woman of 61. She has eight children, two of whom live with her and her husband. Also living with them are two grandchildren, 15 and 11 years old, who are in school. María says that she and her husband raise cattle and that she will use the loan she received from Fodemi to buy a cow. María adds that she started her business when she was a teenager, but that she was able to improve it with Fodemi's support four years back and that the organization continues to help her. María's dream is to keep supporting her grandchildren and offering them what they need to finish their studies. She would like to buy more cattle so she can live a peaceful life and cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy (in photo), aged 29, lives in a village about 30 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has been married since 2006 and has one son who attends school. He works for a place that produces firewood, while his wife is a garment factory worker.  

Any way, Channy does not have a restroom for the family. They are sometimes forced to use a neighbor’s bathroom or relieve themselves in the nearby forest or rice field. It’s not clean, convenient or safe for his family. Facing this situation, Channy decided to apply for a loan to build a restroom. He will also use a part of the loan to build a kitchen off his house.

loans.use: To build a restroom and a kitchen

loans.name: Dúo Los Palomos Group

texts.es:
DUO LOS PALOMOS 
Conformado por la señora luisa victoria de 35 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta y crianza de pollos
La señora luisa victoria  es madre de 3 niños  trabaja en la crianza y destace  de pollo los cuales vende de  martes a sábado en los  asentamientos cercanos a su domicilio ella los  compra  por red los cuales   alimenta y los cría y luego  los destaza y los vende. Los ingresos y ganancias los  ha utilizado en la  compra de  2 vacas las cuales le sirve para poder vender leche a los vecinos. ha sido  bendecida con su negocio por la ayudade kiva por el crédito que se le dio anteriormente.   Desea que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades de vida  se conviertan en personas de bien y profesionales por lo que ella nuevamente toca las puertas de fape para poder comprar algunas redes de pollos para continuar con su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Duo Los Palomos 
One of the group members is Luisa Victoria, 35 years old, who raises and sells chickens.
Luisa Victoria has three children. She raises and slaughters chickens and then sells them from Tuesday to Saturday in markets near her house. She buys them and feeds and raises them before slaughtering and selling them. She has used her profits to buy two cows, which have allowed her to sell milk to her neighbors. She has been blessed in her business by Kiva with the previous loan that she was given.   She wants her children to have better opportunities in life and become successful people with good careers. That is why she has come back to FAPE to request another loan so she can buy more chickens and continue her daily work.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Leonarda, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, principalmente a la venta de leche de vaca, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas y cuyes,la socia tambien tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual ella espera que su negocio prospere, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia Leonarda invertirá su préstamo solicitado para comprar una vaca.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Leonarda is still working raising cows and selling cow’s milk. She has been in the business for many years, and it is going well for her because of her hard work every day. She continues to raise small animals such as pigs, hens, and guinea pigs, and she also has a small grocery shop. She hopes that her business prospers. She would like to keep working and supporting her family.
Leonarda will use the requested loan to buy a cow.
She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business and is committed to making her payments in full.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Norma, la socia continua dedicándose  a la  producción y venta de lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche para su negocio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
This is Norma, who is still making a living from the production and sales of dairy products such as milk, cheeses and yoghurt. She has had her business for a good while and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day. Norma wants to continue doing this work so she can continue to support her family.

Norma is asking for the loan to buy milk for her business. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business and promises to pay her loan instalments punctually.

loans.use: to buy milk for her business.

loans.name: Janata

texts.en:
Janata is a 46-year-old married woman and her husband is 37 years old. They live in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri District. Janata is illiterate and can only sign her name. By occupation, her husband is a farmer. They have three children: one is in grade 8 and the other two children are too small to go to school.

Now Janata and her husband plan to grow potatoes. She has taken out a loan from Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation. She is quite confident that potato cultivation will improve her financial status and generate more profit. She also dreams of building a pacca (concrete) house with the profit from her business to live comfortably with her family.

Janata is really thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for potato cultivation.

loans.name: Relide Elizabeth

texts.es: Relide, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Hace 10 años que ella se dedica a su propio negocio de venta de ropa como pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas de manera ambulante. Ha mantenido su negocio con la inversión de 3 préstamos anteriores, actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir de mercadería como ser blusas, camisas, faldas y pantalones para vender y generar mayor ganancia y así hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Relide is 49 years old; she is a single mother of two children, and lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. For ten years she has had her own business selling clothes (jeans, shirts, skirts and blouses) on the streets. 

She has managed her business with the help of three previous loans, and she is now asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to buy more merchandise, like blouses, shirts, skirts and jeans. With the sale of these, she will generate more incomes to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, like blouses, shirts, skirts and jeans.

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
Secundino tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío de Viza, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad con relieve accidentado lo que le permite tener unos paisajes verdes y con lugares atractivos como cataratas, grutas, pinturas rupestres, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de primeros auxilios, desempeñándose como enfermero en su comunidad, dedicandose a esta labor desde hace 15 años por lo que es conocido en la zona, Secundino ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una puerta y calaminas para el techo de su vivienda dado que es temporada de lluvias y de esta manera tener un lugar seguro para tener residir y atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Secundino is 38 years old and lives with his wife in the hamlet of Viza, a rural area in the Santo Tomás district which has rugged terrain giving rise to green landscapes and attractive places such as waterfalls, caves and cave paintings. This area is situated in the province of Cutervo which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. The local people make a living from agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Secundino provides a first aid service, acting as a nurse in his community. He has been doing this for 15 years and so is well known in the area.

Secundino has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy a door and corrugated iron for the roof of his home, as it is the rainy season. This will give him a secure place to live and attend to his patients.

loans.use: to buy a door and corrugated iron to improve his home.

loans.name: Cristobal Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Pueblo Nuevo, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de plátanos, comercializándolo desde hace 5 años, también se dedica al cultivo de plantas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono urea para mejorar la producción de sus cultivos y de esta manera, generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 62 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Pueblo Nuevo, a rural area in the district of Buenos Aires. The community works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the province of Morropon, in the Piura region of Peru's northern coast.

He has worked as a farmer, growing bananas, for more than five years. He also grows other plants. He has requested a loan of 2,000 soles so he can buy fertilizer to improve his crop yield and thus generate more income for his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his banana and other crops.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda peacefully lives in the village of Solana, in the Philippines.  She is 45 years old, married, and has five children.  

To augment her husband's income, Linda cooks food for daily meals, sells vegetables, and even raises hogs to sell.  These activities allow her to provide a daily allowance to her children.  Her eldest child is now working abroad.  

Linda wants to keep selling delicious meals and fresh vegetables so she is requesting an additional capital amount of 15,000 PHP.  She will buy more bananas, vegetables, chicken, and pork to cook and sell.  The additional funds will help increase sales capacity.

Linda will be happy to see all her children with good paying jobs someday.

loans.use: to buy bananas, vegetables, chicken, and pork to cook and sell.

loans.name: Gianny Klaus

texts.es:
Gianny es un joven soltero que estudia hace tres años ingles profesorado,y por las noches trabaja como Bar tender, el dinero que recibió como préstamo lo va a utilizar para pagar un examen internacional, ya que no cuenta con lo suficiente para solventar ese gasto. Gianny quiere trabajar como profesor de ingles en la universidad en el extranjero y para eso trabaja arduamente, Gianny esta muy feliz y tranquilo por la ayuda que recibe de KIVA por que ese dinero le va ayudar a terminar sus estudios y  a sustentar a su familia.
Gianny dice:" Muchísimas gracias kiva por ayudarme a progresar"
texts.en: Gianny is a single young man who has been studying to teach English for 3 years. At night, he works as a bartender. He is going to use the money he received as a loan to pay for an international exam, since he doesn't have enough money to cover that expense. Gianny wants to work as an English professor at a university abroad and he is working very hard. Gianny is very happy and peaceful because of the help he has received from Kiva since the money is going to help him finish his studies and support his family. Gianny says, "Thank you very much, Kiva, for helping me to improve."

loans.use: to pay for an international exam.

loans.name: Yoan

texts.en:
Yoan (in the photo) is 60, and lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live separately, two are garment factory workers, and another stays at home. 

Yoan and her husband are vegetable farmers. She wants to maintain her vegetable farm by buying nets to sheathe her vegetables from the sun and also to purchase vegetable seeds. That’s why she has asked for a loan.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and nets to sheathe her vegetables from the sun

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her standard of living.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase vegetables, cooking oil, and wheat flour for her business.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.   She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, cooking oil, and wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en: Ia is a 34-year-old divorced woman from Gurjaani district. She has a school-age daughter and mother, who live abroad and work there. Ia takes care of a relative's child and generates 250 laris monthly; however, this income isn't enough to pay for all the daily costs. She has great desire to be involved in another activity. Particularly, Ia's mother will bring clothes and linens from abroad and Ia will sell these products locally for a good price. There are sufficiently low prices in the country where her mother works, and Ia will generate good profit and improve the living conditions of her family. She will be really grateful for Kiva lenders' help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start a business selling clothing and linens

loans.name: Fuerza Compartida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA COMPARTIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Solang ella es soltera y tiene 18 años La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia lo vende por catálogos ofreciendo a diferentes personas o amigos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar labiz labiales, cremas y perfumes.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “FUERZA COMPARTIDA” communal bank. This bank is situated in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

Solang, who is a member, is 18 years old and is single. She works in her business selling beauty products, selling lipsticks, creams and perfumes. She sells through catalogues which she offers to various people and friends. She works from 8am to 6pm.  She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Solang's dream is to have a shop where she can sell her beauty products. She is asking for the loan to buy lipsticks, creams and perfumes. 

The businesses which the other members work in are: selling mobile phones, selling cakes, a grocery shop and a restaurant.

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo had her photo taken after the meeting, as she asked permission for this for work reasons. 

Solang thanks everyone who is involved via this process in being part of her dream, and promises to pay her loan instalments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, onions and two sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, a mother of five, earns a living by managing her own farm to grow different types of crops.  She has earned a good income over the past three years in this business, and is capable of supporting the needs of her children and improving their standard of living.    

Juliet had to double her efforts in order to provide a better education for her children and has taken a loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizer.  She hopes to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose Wilmer

texts.es:
José Wilmer tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Malleta, una zona rural situada cerca al Río Marañón, que pertenece al Distrito Santo Tomas, la población de Malleta se dedica al cultivo de arroz y comercio, tiene un clima caluroso, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de chofer en una empresa de la zona, transportando a pasajeros a la ciudad de Jaén, es conocido en el medio por su carisma y buen servicio que brinda, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas para su vehículo, permitiéndole generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Wilmer is 44 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the small village of Malleta, a rural area near the Marañón river, which is in the Santo Tomás district. The people of Malleta make a living in commerce and by growing rice. Malleta has a hot climate. It is located in the Cutervo province, in the Cajamarca region, which is in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works as a driver for a company in the area, transporting passengers to the city of Jaén. He is known for his charisma and the good service that he provides. He is requesting a loan from 'Edpyme Alternativa' for 1,000 soles for the purchase of tires for his vehicle, allowing him to generate income for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Excequiel

texts.es:
Excequiel tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, desde hace 10 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de un torete para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Excequiel is 69 years old and lives with his wife and kids in the district of Callayuc - a community dedicated to agriculture, trade and raising cattle, situated in the Province of Cutervo in the Region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has raised and sold cattle for the last 10 years and his wife helps him in this work. He has requested a loan of 600 new soles to buy a young bull to fatten so that he can get a better price for him, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: buy a young bull for fattening

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

 La socia es la Sra. Corina ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y elaboración de helados, la socia prepara helados a base de yogurt en diferentes sabores, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia los helados los vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los helados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para preparar los helados como leche, yogurt y azúcar.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de helados, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the “SEÑOR DE HUANCA” communal bank; this bank is situated in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco.

Member Mrs. Corina lives with her partner, is 46 years old and has 4 children. She sells and makes ice creams in different flavours with yoghurt as a base. She works from 8:00a.m. to 4:00p.m. She is a traveling salesperson and has been in this business for a number of years. It is going very well and she dreams of having a fixed location from where she can sell her ice cream. Mrs. Corina is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for her ice creams such as milk, yoghurt and sugar. 

The other members sell ice creams, clothes, groceries and food.

The photos of the other members of the group who are in the smaller photos attached to the group photo were taken after the meeting, which they excused from due to work commitments.

The member (Mrs. Corina) thanks those who are part of making this dream come true and commits to paying her repayments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: buy raw materials for her ice creams such as milk, yoghurt and sugar.

loans.name: Jurine

texts.en:
To earn a living, Jurine  owns and operates a business, planting and harvesting vegetables and fruits. Aside from this, she has her piggery business, growing pigs to sell. She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for her farm. 

Recently, Jurine took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy feed in order to boost her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is a married man from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in a chainsaw business. This is the source of his income.
Celso is asking for a loan to buy an additional chainsaw. With this, he will be able to improve his business, thus augmenting his income. In the future, Celso hopes to make his business a success and save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy an additional chainsaw

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the products needed in her business.
