Her loan also helped not just in her business, but also the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.
 
She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan for her to buy more quantities and varieties of spices. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Annabel dreams to have other sources of income and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. Here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities and varieties of spices.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.en:
Maria Irma, 27, is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

Maria Irma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, paint, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalinda has been in this business for three years now.

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Georgee

texts.en:
Meet Georgee, a farmer living in the Kitale area of the Northern rift. He is married and has one child of school-going age. Georgee has practiced farming for three years, with his primary income sources being milk and crops, and he also has a retail business. He enjoys dairy farming the most because of the milk production, but his biggest challenge is diseases.

Georgee chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they are faster in their service delivery and their interest rates are lower. During the training, he learned that MFIs give short-term loans to low income earners. This loan will enable Georgee to educate his siblings and also to plan ahead for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is a 44-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been manufacturing plastic bottles through an injection molding machine for many years. He buys plastic crushing raw material from the market, and puts it into the injection molding machine. The raw material melts under high temperature, and it is then injected it into the dies through compression, giving it a specific shape. In this way, he manufactures the bottles, sells them into the market, and generates enough income to contribute to her family's livelihood.

Kausar is the mother of four children, and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and an education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well.  

Currently she has requested a loan for her husband to buy more raw materials for manufacturing so that he could increase his sales. She expects a boost in their earnings, and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business.

Kausar is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy plastic crushing raw material for manufacturing bottles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 36-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters, and her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband owns a carton selling business. He purchases different size cartons from the market and sells them to the customers for packing purposes. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relation with his customers. 

Zahida's husband requested a loan so that he would be able to buy more stock of cartons. Therefore, Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can purchase more cartons to easily to fulfill his business needs. Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cartons for resale.

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.ru:
Дмитрий женат. У него есть маленький сын Данил.  Дмитрий имеет свой бизнес. 

Дмитрий занимается продажей спортивной обуви на центральном рынке. У него собственное торговое место и большой опыт работы. Наиболее популярными товарами являются мужская и детская спортивная обувь. Дмитрий ответственный и трудолюбивый.

Дмитрий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на закупку сезонной обуви. Кредит поможет ему увеличить прибыль.
texts.en: Dmitriy is married and has a young son named Danil.  He is a responsible and hardworking man who his own shoe store at a nearby market.  He has his own market stall there and a lot of experience selling shoes to go with it.  His most popular items are athletic shoes for men and young kids.  He is seeking a loan of 15000 hryvnia to stock up on seasonal varieties of shoes as this will allow him to earn more money.

loans.use: stock up on seasonal types of shoes

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha previously accessed a loan of 20,000 PHP that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
Editha would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her food stall business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Editha dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week she meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and other products needed in her food stall business.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a responsible mother who helps her husband in generating income. She runs a small variety store within her community. Due to financial hardships, Saturnina aims to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income and meet the needs of her family. She plans to acquire additional stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, Saturnina is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, and seasonings to sell. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will further improve her business someday.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Eulalyn

texts.en:
Eulalyn is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three young children. Eulalyn has been engaged in a rice farming business for several years now. She also runs a retail business, selling clothing and slippers.

Eulalyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and more stocks to sell, like clothing and slippers. With this loan, she will be able to improve her farm, as well as her retail business. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and more stocks to sell, like clothing and slippers.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 52 years old and is married with four children. With two children currently in school, Rosenda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, etc. to sell.

Rosenda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, etc. 

Rosenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette is 30 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Nanette has been raising livestock for 7 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 47 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Susana has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, coffee, sugar, vinegar, etc. 

In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and married with four children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries like snack foods, candies, shampoo, canned goods, soy sauce, cereals, etc. to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling coconut shells.

Teresita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like snack foods, candies, shampoo, canned goods, soy sauce, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 26-year-old farmer living in the Kitale area of North Rift, Kenya, with his wife and two children. He has been farming for 8 years with his source of income being milk, eggs, and crops. He also runs a transportation service and a retail business. In farming, he enjoys dairy farming whereas his biggest challenge is livestock diseases.

Andrew chose Juhudi Kilimo since they can enable him to improve his farming activities. During the training, he learnt the importance of directing his loan to the intended projects. Andrew says that through this loan he will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more sacks of cereals for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cereals for her business

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six daughters and a son.

Zarina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a shoe maker by profession. He has been making shoes since his childhood. This is the reason he has a lot of experience in his profession. He makes shoes by hand and his handmade shoes are very famous in his hometown. Previously, he only provided services to his clients for shoe making.  Now that he has gotten a lot of market experience, he wants to buy materials such as buy leather, rexine, buckles, nails, soles, glue, and thread for shoe making so that he can earn more than before. 

Zarina wants to construct her house, provide a better education to her children, and help in the establishment of her husband's business. She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy leather, rexine, buckles, nails, soles, glue, and thread for shoe making.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 31, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a book binder and binds book at home. She helps him for the completion of her daily tasks. Her husband uses cardboard, loop wire, gum and thread for books binding. He takes orders from book publishers, and binds books on order. For the time being he has been fulfilling many contracts, but this time he has gotten a larger contract than earlier. The major problem is that he does not have enough cash on hand to buy raw materials for book binding.  
 
Therefore, Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy raw material such as cardboard, loop wire, gum, threads etc. to continue his business.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as cardboard, loop wire, gum and thread for book binding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, iron, and an over machine to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida is the age of 56; she is mother of two sons. She  lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products like milk, curd, butter, for sale. He owns a small dairy farm that consists of buffalos and cows. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earning from the milk sales.  

He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income. So, Rashida asked for this loan. In this way, she can support to her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for producing milk, curd, and butter

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 28 years old; she is the mother of four children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sews school bags; he has two sewing machines for doing this. He has been sewing bags on order now; he wants to sell his sewed bags directly into the market, so Naseem can get maximum reward against his efforts. But she does not have initial capital to buy raw material for sewing bags. Therefore, Naseem has made a loan request to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy raw material such as rexine, zippers, buckles, foam, etc. for sewing bags. Naseem thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rexine, zippers, foam, and buckles for sewing school bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, iron, and fabric.

loans.name: Musalam

texts.en:
Musalam is 39 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She is the only breadwinner for her two children. 

Ten years ago, Musalam began her own business because she needed money. Musalam sells women’s and children’s clothes. She has her regular customers. 

Musalam must buy children’s and women’s clothes for the new season. She is asking for a loan of TJS 5,000 (somoni) to buy clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Rubén Antonio

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón es un pequeño Municipio donde existen personas emprendedoras, con deseo de superar en su vida, es aquí donde habita la joven Rubén Antonio. 

Rubén Antonio Es una joven de 40 años de edad Soltero, cuenta con tres hijito bajo su cargo, con lo poco que el gana ayuda a mantener a su hijito que tanto ama y estima. 

Trabaja en una de las instituciones del estado teniendo 19 años de laborar bajo el cargo técnico de vectores, siendo que este puesto de trabajo le toca caminar a diferentes comunidades de su municipio a 10 KM de distancia.

 Se siente agotado en su empeño profesional que realiza a diarios por lo que le solicita a Ceprodel y Kiva que le brinde el apoyo Necesario para su trabajo debido a esta necesidad solicita a través de un crédito un nuevo financiamiento Para la compra de Una Motocicleta esto le ayudaría a mejorar las condiciones de su trabajo.  
 
El considera que esto sería de gran importancia por lo que ayuda a mantener mejor su trabajo y asi poder sacar adelante a su familia. 

Espera en Dios Una respuesta positiva y son de sus sueños llegar a obtener su propio medio de transporte para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a small municipality which is home to enterprising people with a desire to succeed in life. Rubén Antonio lives here.

Rubén Antonio is 40 years old and single. He has three children under his care. With the little money he earns, he helps to maintain his sons, whom he loves and appreciates very much.

He has been working at a state institution for 19 years in a technical vector position. This position demands that he travel to different communities in his municipality, which are ten kilometers away.

He feels overwhelmed in his daily work. Therefore, he has applied for a loan from Ceprodel and Kiva to support his work financially. He will use this loan to buy a motorcycle, which would help him to improve his working conditions. He believes that this will be very important to keep his job and provide for his family.

He hopes for a positive response from God, and obtaining his own means of transport for work is one of his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y se dedica la venta de comida y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar. Abraham está feliz por otro préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Abraham is a hardworking, enterprising man who provides for his family. He makes a living selling food. He needs this loan to buy bags of rice and sugar. 

Abraham is happy with this loan and he promises to comply with the payment of his installments.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Dulamsuren is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in their ger, a traditional nomadic yurt in Uvs province, Mongolia. 

Her husband Batbold is unemployed and works part-time in construction sites during summers. Her daughters are under age 11 and all attend local public school. 

Dulamsuren moved to the province center from the countryside in 2011. She started working as a waitress in a local small cafeteria and currently started her own cobbler business at home with her husband. She used to help her parents when she was a little. She has experience and is already being appreciated for her qualified products. 

She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase raw materials to produce more shoes to sell to local customers. She is a hard-working and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to produce more shoes to sell to local customers

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Ana María, continua  dedicándose  a la  ganaderia y producción de venta  de lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
L asocia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca y el arreglo de su retablo.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
The partner is Ana María, who continues to make her living in ranching, and the production and sale of dairy products like milk, cheese and yogurt. The partner has been working in this business for a good while. It is going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her business everyday.

The partner raises these young animals to later sell them to her customers who ask for them. She wants to be able to continue working so she can continue supporting her family in this way.

The partner is applying for this loan to buy a cow and to repair her altarpiece. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her flourish in her business, and she is committed to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to repair her altarpiece.

loans.name: Giselle

texts.en:
Giselle is a married woman and the mother of two young children, ages 5 and 3. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 5 years now. This is the source of their income.

Giselle is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. Through this, her husband will be able to catch more fish, thus, augmenting their sales and income. In the future, Giselle hopes to make their fishing business a success. In addition, she wants to save money for the future schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has had a gardening business for a living. She grows and harvests mung beans and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in her garden. 

Lolita worked hard to improve their living situation. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase organic pesticides and new varieties of seedlings. In the future, she wants to expand her garden by adding more plots of mung beans and rest assured to gain more profits for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticides and new varieties of seedlings

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Due to financial insufficiency, Saturnina engages in raising hogs to have an additional source of income. She is 58 years old and widowed. Despite this, she has the determination to improve her family's standard of living and to give her family a better life.

To further improve her business, Saturnina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional piglets, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 40-year-old married woman with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosita has a general store business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for one year.

Rosita requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a well established farmer living in Kitale with her husband and eight children, who are all grown up. She really values farming because it has been her main source of income for 18 years. She sells milk, eggs, and crops. She enjoys dairy and poultry farming the most.

Beatrice chose Juhudi Kilimo because she wants Juhudi to help boost and improve her farming activities, and because their loans are short term and have a low interest rate.

This loan will bring alot of benefit to her and her family by improving their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is 43 years old, and he lives in the village Aygehovit in Tavush region. He is married and he has two school-aged children. Seyran’s mother also lives with them, and she is already retired. 

For several years, Seyran was a contractual serviceman. Now three days a week he works as a forester and since he manages to have a lot of free time, he is engaged in farming and agriculture. His wife helps him greatly and together they take care of four cows, three pigs, and thirty chickens. On their plot of land they cultivate corn, wheat and some vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and greens) and fruits (apples, plums, and figs). The main source of their family income is the sale of their farm products: meat, piglets, dairy products, eggs, fruits, and vegetables. 

Seyran is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to increase number of his farm animals, and he wants to buy a pig and a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to get more farm animals and a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a farmer living in the Kitale area of North rift, Kenya with her husband and thee children. 

She has been farming for nine years and her primary income source is selling milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services.I n farming, she enjoys dairy and poultry farming, while her biggest challenge is diseases.

Elizabeth chose Juhudi Kilimo to finance her because Juhudi finances farmers with loans to improve their farming activities. During the training, she learned that MFIs do give short term loans to low income earners. With the output from this loan, she will be able to educate her children well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita is 50 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Tomasita has a general store business in the Philippines. Tomasita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like bath soap, seasonings, cereals, eggs, canned goods, toothpaste, bread, etc. to sell.

Tomasita has been in this business for one year. Tomasita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like bath soap, seasonings, cereals, eggs, canned goods, toothpaste, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en: Shabnam is a 27-year-old married woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Shabnam's family is ultra-poor.  She has been feeding her children. Now her children are growing old and their needs are growing as well. She has been saving money for many days to buy a new moto-rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing was short of money. Therefore, Shabnam requested a loan so she could buy a new moto-rickshaw with the contribution of her savings.  She hopes that now her husband can easily generate reasonable income to support his family. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new moto-rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
Sabohat is 44 years old. She is an industrious woman. Sabohat lives with her husband and their three children in a house that is located in a little village. 

Sabohat works in a local hospital as a cleaning woman. She is a very clean woman and she does her job well. Sabohat has a small salary, which is not enough for living. That is why she is going to organize an additional business in animal husbandry and in this way earn more of a living. Sabohat wants to improve her living conditions with her profits. 

Sabohat is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing her new business

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya was born in 1970. She is a hard-working woman who tries for the well-being of her child. She is divorced. Zulfiya lives with her parents and brother. She has some nieces. Her child is 10 years old. 

Zulfiya has her own business. She sells industrial goods, like buckets, kettles, and cauldrons. She began her business with a little working capital and, little by little, she developed her business. Her business is the only source of income for her child and herself. 

Zulfiya is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000 (somoni) to buy industrial goods, like buckets and kettles, to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy industrial goods, like buckets and kettles, to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Mrs.Enhjargal is 25 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband works in the local military service. 
Enhjargal started her small retail store in 2013. She used to work as saleswoman for few years and has experience in running a clothing retail business. She has good taste and customers like buying from her. She is hardworking, friendly and pleasant woman who is now in need 2,500,000MNT to purchase clothes and other small retail items to continue running her business and generate more return.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and other small retail items to continue running her business and generate more return

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de pizzas pues tiene dos pequeños locales donde preparar sus ricas pizzas, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Huayna Picchu" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a female entrepreneur who works very hard. She makes pizzas as she owns two small establishments where she prepares her delicious pizzas.

She's a member of the "Huayna Picchu" communal bank at the Arariwa Association and she requires a loan to purchase raw materials such as bags of flour.

loans.use: raw materials for making pizzas, such as bags of flour.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es: Amilcar es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad economica es brindar servicio Medico Tecnológico y en sus horas libres atiende su pequeño consultorio de fisioterapias. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo tarjetas ultrasonidos.
texts.en:
Amilcar is an enterprising, hardworking person who provides for his family. His business activity is providing services as a medical technician. In his free time, he works in his small physical therapy clinic.

He needs this loan to buy working materials, such as ultrasonic cards.

loans.use: to buy working materials, such as ultrasonic cards.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
El socio Crisologo se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,el socio vende pantalones,casacas y chompas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6.00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa.El socio solicita el credito para comprar polos,casacas y chompas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Crisologo still works in his business selling clothes. He sells pants, dress coats, and sweaters. He works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. He has had this business for several years, and it is going very well. His dream is to expand his clothing business. 

He has applied for a loan to buy polo shirts, coats, and sweaters. He is happy with this loan and he promises to comply with the payment of his installments.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, coats, and sweaters.

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Marilyn is a married woman and a mother of four children.  She is from Trinidad, Bohol. Marilyn has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a farmer.

Ma. Marilyn is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Ma. Marilyn hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie lives in Misamis Occidental with her three children. She runs a general store selling goods in her village to earn a living and she has had this business for three years.  

Elsie borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional grocery goods. In the future, she wants to improve her house and be able to give her children the education she did not have. Elsie plans to expand her store in order to earn more income for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of quality used clothes needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in covering personal, household and business expenditures. Analiza also has a food stall for additional income.
 
Analiza would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of quality used clothes needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analiza hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of quality used clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lanie

texts.en:
This is Ma. Lanie, 48, resident of Malibay, Pasay City Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a driver operator and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Lanie oversees and owns operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle.

Ma. Lanie hopes to have more tricycle units and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Veronica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten bags of cement

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a 43-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for many years. She has two cows for milk. She sells milk in her locality and counts a good client list. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She has five children, all of whom are school going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation to meet the day to day expenses of life. Now she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. It will help her to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Zhamila

texts.en: Zhamila is hard-working woman. She is married and has five children. She lives with her family in a rural area. Zhamila is a very careful mother for her five children. Two of them are non-adults. Zhamila has her own animal husbandry business. She began her business in this field 10 years ago. She feeds cows and sells their milk. She also grows agricultural products such as maize. She works hard from early morning until late evening. Her daughter and son help her with managing the business. She would like to increase the number of cattle she feeds. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Erdenesuh

texts.en:
Erdenesuh is 40 years old.  He lives with his wife and 3 children in a traditional nomadic yurt house in Ger, in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his wife started their family business of a tire-repair service in a local market in 2011. His 3 children study at local schools. Erdenesuh is a hard-working man who always takes care of his family and dreams of raising his children to be educated and better people. 

He opened a small retail clothing store in 2012 for his wife to run in order to increase their family income. She has pleased her customers over the years with her affordable, quality clothes selection. Erdenesuh is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventory to enable his wife to run her business with a higher return.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory to enable his wife to run her business with a higher return

loans.name: Rogaciano

texts.en:
Rogaciano is a married man and a father of five children. The eldest is 12 and the youngest is three years old. Rogaciano lives with his family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in motorcycle transport business locally known as habal-habal. This is the source of his income.
Rogaciano is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle such as tires, nuts and bolts, chains and oil. With this he will be able to maintain and improve the working condition of the motorcycle. Rogaciano hopes to make his business a success. Moreover he wants to save money to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle such as  tires, nuts and bolts, chains and oil

loans.name: Orange Group

texts.en:
Joseline is a mother of six grown children and two school-age grand-kids. She is in her mid sixties and married. 

Joseline sell fruits and vegetables and has been in business for two years. She works from 7:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan.  She will use the money to buy more fruits and vegetables.  Joseline hopes to attarct more customers. 

She is doing well and hopes to save more for her future. 

Joseline will share this loan with her loan group "ORANGE" which consist of seven members.  They will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine has been running a general store to make a living. She has unluckily encountered problems because of a health crisis. But, in spite of that, she still copes with determination. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase grocery stocks to sell. In the future she wants to build a house where her family can live better and more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase grocery stocks to sell

loans.name: Leodan

texts.es:
Leodan de 38 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado, pues las condiciones económicas de su familia no le permitieron seguir estudiando, él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos  en su vivienda y a cuidar de sus hijos, ellos tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo tres tiene en su vivienda, pues los otros dos ya están acompañados, las edades de los que están en su vivienda son de un niño de 7 años,  una niña de 6 y el último de 2 años de edad, en su vivienda solo viven ellos 5 su esposa, sus 3 hijos y él.

Leodan presta sus servicios de militar en el ejército desde hace 11 años; pues es su principal y única fuente de ingresos para su familia, él logro entrar al ejército gracias al apoyo de un amigo que lo recomendó para que pudiera entrar a trabajar hace 11 años. También en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos) y que es un aporte de alimentos para su familia.  Él se traslada para su trabajo en el autobus con 2 horas de viaje, el trabajo no le permite llegar a su casa a diario, sino que tiene que estar 8 días dentro de la institución para salir 4 días libres y poder llegar a su casa. 

El financiamiento lo utilizara para la remodelación de su vivienda, específicamente lo que el remodelara será el techo de su vivienda pues las condiciones que presenta no son las adecuadas para vivir y más aún que ya se acerca el invierno es su mayor preocupación que se le moje sus pertenencias dentro de su casa, comprara tejas, laminas  y madera.

Leodan  desea para el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para él, su esposa y sus hijos, vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para su familia y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que en el futuro sean personas profesionales  y logren terminar sus estudios y sacar  una carrera universitaria todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su esposa, mucho trabajo y por supuesto con futuros prestamos que sacara.
texts.en:
Leodan, 38, studied up until the fourth grade. His family's financial circumstances did not allow him to continue studying. He is married, and his wife is dedicated to the household duties and caring for the children. They have five children, of whom three are still living at home. The other two children are already living with their partners. The children who live at home with Leodan and his wife are their 7-year-old son, their 6-year-old daughter, and their 2-year-old son. 

Leodan has been serving as a soldier in the military for 11 years. This is his main and only source of income for his family. He managed to join the army thanks to the support of a friend who recommended him 11 years ago. In his free time, he works in agriculture (growing basic grains) to provide food for his family. He goes to work by bus, which is a 2-hour journey. His work does not allow him to come home every day. He has to be in the institution for 8 days, and he then has 4 days free to go home.

He will use this loan to remodel his home, specifically the roof. His home is not currently in adequate living conditions, especially since the winter is coming. His greatest concern is that their belongings will get wet. He will buy roof tiles, metal sheets, and wood.

Leodan hopes that he, his wife, and his children will have a better quality of life in the future and that they will live comfortably in a decent home. He also hopes that his children will continue studying so that they can become professionals and finish their studies to go on to university. He and his wife will achieve all of this with plenty of effort and dedication, hard work, and loans which he will take out in the future.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, metal sheets, and wood.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 26 year-old housewife. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. She has one son and two daughters. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. Presently he is unable to generate income as his rickshaw has stopped working. 

Sumera has asked for a KIVA loan from KIVA's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase a new rickshaw so that he can continue generating income. This will also help him to increase his savings. 

Sumera says that she will purchase furniture for her house. She is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes and cow skin to sell.

loans.name: Davlathonim

texts.en:
Davlathonim was born in 1963 and is married with four children. Two of them are children. 

She is a hardworking business lady who sells children clothes.  Davlathonim has worked in this field more than 15 years. 

Davlathonim is very sociable and this helps her attract customers.  She tries to renew her goods every season. But she does not enough money to buy for Spring.  She is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy children clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy children clothes.

loans.name: Bella Fe

texts.en: Bella Fe is a diligent mother who is involved in the hog-raising business to help her husband in financing the education of her two children. Due to the high cost of school fees, they need to increase their income in order to support their children's education and satisfy their necessities. In this regard, Bella Fe plans to acquire more piglets to raise. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. For more than seven years in running the business, it was observed that she has gained better income and was able to improve the business. She successfully repaid her previous loan used in the business operation. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods and beverages. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and beverages

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Milagros hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her children will have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business in weekly meetings, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise, like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Waliyat

texts.en: Waliyat is a 50-years-old married woman. She has been living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five daughters and four sons. She does embroidery work by hand at home to help financially support her family. She belongs to a poor family, her husband’s income is very poor so that she decided to start embroidery work at home. She learned these arts in her childhood, now she has adopted them for her occupation. She makes herself independent and earns sufficient income. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colours. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Waliyat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is kind woman. She lives with her husband and 4 children. Her house is located in the North part of Tajikistan. She sells dried fruit in a local market. Her husband helps her with selling dried fruit. She has been busy with this business more than 10 years. Mavluda’s daughter studies at the Medical college. She studies well and has dreams of being a good doctor. Mavluda must pay for her daughter’s education, but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan to pay for her daughter’s education in the Medical collage. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s education in a Medical collage

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La socia Consuelo se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa por catalogos,la socia trabaja llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender zapatos y ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zapatos y ropa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Association member Consuelo continues with her business of selling clothing and shoes by catalog. She sells her products by taking them to different places such as institutions. She works from 8 a.m to 7 p.m and has been in this business for a number of years. Her dream is to have a fixed location from where she can sell shoes and clothes. Consuelo is requesting this loan to buy shoes and clothes.

She is happy to be receive this loan and commits to paying off her monthly payments.

loans.use: buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Aleja, la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura y a la ganadería, la socia lleva años dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para arreglar su establo.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: The loan recipient, Aleja, continues to work in agriculture and raise livestock, which she has been doing for years. It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. Aleja is a responsible and diligent person; thus, she is able to get her family ahead. She is requesting this loan to repair her barn. Aleja is very grateful to Kiva for helping her with her business. She is committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to repair her barn.

loans.name: Apu Los Nevados Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Apu Los Nevados” en la comunidad de Carpapampa en el distrito de Paucartambo y provincia de Paucartambo. 

Sonia tiene 25 años de edad y es casada, ella y su familia viven en la comunidad de Carpapampa.  

Sonia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que desde muy niña aprendió de sus padres la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería, ella es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante cultivando papa, trigo, cebada y avena, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, gallinas y cuyes y también al engorde de ganado entonces él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes.  
  
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores, a la venta y el engorde de ganado. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. ( La persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía saco después el crédito)
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends make up the “Apu Los Nevados” communal bank of the Carpapampa community, in the Paucartambo district, Paucartambo province.  This communal bank is made up of various people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and give their children a better future through their daily efforts.  The members work in farming, cattle, raising small animals, and fattening cattle to sell.

Sonia is 25 years old and married.  She and her family live in the community of Carpapampa.  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who learned farming from her parents from the time she was a young girl.  She learned to raise small animals and cattle.  She is a charismatic and kind person who is getting ahead by raising potatoes, wheat, barley, and oats.  In her free time, she raises sheep, chickens, and guinea pigs.  She also fattens cattle.  At this point, she needs a loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs.

The members are grateful for the opportunity given to them and are committed to completing their established payments.  (The person who appears in the lower part of the photo took out a loan later.)

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a motortaxi for renting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, with two attending school.  She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over two years she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.  She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan Umazi wants to purchase a stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruits, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza was born in 1964. She is a smart woman. Hafiza is a repeat client of IMON and she has a good credit history. Hafiza is married and has adult children. 

Hafiza is a businesswoman, and she sells nuts in a local market from her own selling place. Hafiza used her previous loans to develop her business. Now, she is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni  (TJS) to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. to repair her house. Her house is old and in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni (TJS) with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. to repair her house

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio Rolando se sigue dedicando al trabajo de servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles,el socio ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Roland continues to work offering taxi services.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m., offering taxi service on different streets.  He has been doing this work for seven years, and it is going really well for him.  His dream is to buy a new car.  

He is asking for a loan to buy tires for his car.  He is happy to have the loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Pilly, who is in her mid thirties, is single and has been managing her life by running a wholesale and retail business selling drinks. She has had this business for two years. Pilly starts her business at 07 am and finishes at 06 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock business drinks such as beer, soda, juice and water for resale. With her previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, Pilly used them to buy empty of beer and soda and restocked her drinks stock. Pilly managed to earn an extra income, which she used to buy a sofa set and covered her household expenses and rent.  She wishes to see her business grow with enough capital to supply big a stock of drinks. Pilly would like in the coming years to be a successful woman. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " MPUNGA " which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock business drinks such as beer, soda, juice and water to resell.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is the age of 36. She is the mother of one daughter. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Fouzia's husband works selling dairy products, like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. Daily, he sells milk to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He was in need of one buffalo, to increase his income. So, Fouzia requested a loan. In this way, she can support her husband's business. She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 35-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children and equally responsible for all of them. She belongs to an ultra poor family – that is why she cannot afford the educational expenses of all her children. One of her sons goes with his father to help him in manufacturing accessories. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he manufactures iron accessories, such as doors, windows, gates, etc. He also provides door-to-door services to weld iron accessories of his customers. Due to increases in the price of iron, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials, such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc., to carry on his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding material. Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he will be able to buy raw materials to carry on his business. She is very glad and thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy welding rods, soldering rods and iron goods for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Karoti Group

texts.en:
Pendo, who is in her late 20s, is married and has three children. Two of her children are in school while another is still a baby. 

Pendo makes her family living by running a business, selling powdered and bar soap. She has been in this business since 2004. Pendo has good experience with this business. She is able to order big stocks and sell all of it to customers. She runs her business from 7am to 9pm per working day and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Pendo's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Pendo used the previous loans, all of which have been fully paid, to buy stocks of soap. She still maintains her sales levels although she needs to grow the business, so as to earn extra income and make her life better. Pendo made a profit which she used to reinvest in her business and to cover part of her family's needs. 

She will use this loan to buy stocks of soap to resell. Pendo dreams that one day she will be able to sell her business stocks in wholesale. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Karoti Group, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap to resell.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia es la señora María Cleofe la socia tiene 38 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia se dedica a la ganadería,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez la socia se dedica a la  agricultura, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
L Asocia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca para su negocio.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
This borrower is Señora María Cleofe.  She is 38 years old.  She has three children and is married.  She works in cattle.  She has been doing this work for quite a while, and it is going well for her, thanks to the efforts she puts into her work every day.  She raises these animals to later sell to customers who ask for them.  At the same time, she works in farming, and in this way she is getting her family ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy a cow for her business.  She is very thankful to Kiva for helping her to develop her business, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory and equipment to start his business

loans.name: Kusacha De Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Beatriz nació en la ciudad Atalaya y tiene 48 años de edad, actualmente ella vive en la hermosa ciudad de Pilcopata junto con su pareja y con sus seis hijos y son muy felices, ella saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues su actividad económica principal es ayudar en el taller de carpintería de su esposo con el acabado de los muebles. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Kusacha de Pilcopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Pilcopata se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la venta de fruta, a la venta de coca, a la ganadería, al engorde de ganado, a la venta y compra de madera. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(la persona que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión).
texts.en:
Beatriz was born in the city of Atalaya and is 48 years old. She currently lives in the charming city of Pilcopata with her partner and their six children and they are very happy. She helps her family get ahead with a lot of effort and dedication as her main economic activity is to help in her husband's woodshop by finishing furniture. She has been dedicating herself to this for a number of years and it is going very well thanks to her determination in her work. She is part of the “Kusacha de Pilcopata” communal bank and is requesting a loan to buy materials for her work such as wood. She is grateful and values this loan and commits to paying off her monthly repayments very responsibly. (The people of Pilcopata stand out for their trade of forest products as well as hospitality services and restaurants. It is at the entry point to the Manu National Park).

This communal bank consists of several people who are constantly looking for opportunities to move forward, and with their daily efforts they give their children a better future. The members work in agriculture, selling fruits, selling coca, raising cattle, fattening cattle and buying and selling wood. The members are grateful for the opportunity they have been offered, and pledge to make their repayments on time. (The person in the attached photo arrived late to the meeting).

loans.use: buy materials for her work such as wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used bags to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for medical drugs and treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rocío Magaly

texts.es:
La Señora Roció forman parte del grupo de Créditos El Mirador, este es su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas, con quienes ha compartido buenos momentos y espera que sus metas se cumplan con los créditos. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de hermosos paisajes, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.
La Señora. Rocío tiene 27 años de edad, es separada de su esposo, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 11, 8 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad.
Doña Rocío de dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 meses, ofrece sus productos de domingo a domingo y cuando se le presenta una oportunidad. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de ropa para crecer en el negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Rocío is part of the “El Mirador” credit group.  This is the second loan that she has taken out alongside her friends, with whom she has shared some good times.  She hopes that she can achieve her goals with the loans.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city of beautiful scenery and, since December 1999, a World Heritage site for culture.

Señora Rocío is 27 years old.  She is separated from her husband, but from her marriage has three children, ages 2, 8, and 11.  Her oldest two children are studying in one of the city schools.

Doña Rocío has worked selling clothing for five months now.  She offers her products all week long, and whenever she has an opportunity.  She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of clothing to expand her business.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Riksa

texts.en:
Riksa runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Riksa is married and living with three persons in the family home. 

Riksa began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has had around $12 - $13 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for his business.

loans.name: Mahurat

texts.en:
Mahurat is a kind woman. She was born in year 1965. Mahurat is married and has two children. Her husband, Kamoliddin, is an immigrant in Russia. She is a smart woman. She was one of the best pupils in school, but she did not have the opportunity to get a higher education. Now, she tries to help her children get higher education. 

Mahurat’s son studies at the university in Novosibirsk. She must pay for her son’s education, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 1,250 USD to pay for her son’s education. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for education of her son.

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Vang is in his early 20s and is single. He makes his living by running a barbershop. He has been in this enterprise for two years and he opens his shop from 07 am to 10 pm every working day. Vang is able to generate a fair monthly profit. He is a good shaver and hair cut designer. 

This is his second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy a special shaving machine for his barbershop. He used the previous loan to buy barbershop equipment. Vang repaid the entire previous loan successfully. He used his profit to cover his rent and food. He dreams that one day he will be able to buy a plot of land where he will build a house. 

Vang will share this loan with his loan group" Bahari", which totals eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a special shaving machine for his barber shop.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 56 años de edad, casado y padre de 5 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Durante 30 años de su vida productiva, se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de frutas, verduras y panela, los productos se los compra al por mayor a los campesinos del municipio y los revende al por menor en la plaza de mercado y, cada 8 días lleva productos para venderlos en otro municipio cercano, así ha logrado ganarse la vida y sacar adelante a su numerosa familia; la actividad la aprendió de un hermano que se dedica a la misma labor.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará surtido de papa capira, papa criolla, arveja y fríjol al por mayor, así obtendrá mayores descuentos y podrá aumentar el margen de ganancia por venta, logrando una mejor rentabilidad de su negocio.
Carlos manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad a su labor, pues se siente a gusto con ella y además es su principal fuente de ingresos, esto le permitirá solventar los gastos familiares por mucho más tiempo y disfrutar junto a sus seres amados de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 56, is a humble and hard-working man from the country.  His is married and has five children.  He has gotten them ahead with effort and sacrifice.

During the 30 years of his productive life he has been buying and felling fruit, vegetables, and ‘panela’ [sweetener].  He buys the products wholesale from the farmers in the municipality.  He resells them at retail at the plaza in the market.  Every eight days he takes products to sell in another municipality that is nearby.  This way he has managed to earn a living and to get his large family ahead.  He learned this business activity from a brother, who does the same work.

He will use the requested loan to buy stock like different kinds of potatoes, peas, and beans wholesale.  This way he will get greater discounts, and he will be able to increase the profit margin of his sales.  He will manage to get better profitability from his business.

Carlos says that his greatest desire is to continue with his work.  He likes it, and it is his main source of income.  This will allow him to pay for the family expenses for a lot longer.  He will also enjoy a better quality of life with his loved ones.

loans.use: to buy stock like different kinds of potatoes, peas, and beans wholesale.

loans.name: Blanca Esmeralda

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca forma parte del grupo de crédito El Mirador, se encuentra en este grupo desde hace 3 años y medio, tiempo en el que ha llegado a establecer una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras del grupo, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le benefician para su negocio. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de hermosos paisajes, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.
La Señora. Blanca tiene 34 años de edad, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 17 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Blanca es comerciante de artesanías en especial se dedica a la venta de sombreros de paja toquilla,  vende este producto de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar sombreros de paja toquilla para continuar creciendo en su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is part of the “El Mirador” credit group.  She has been in this group for three and a half years.  In that time, she has come to form a strong friendship with all of her groupmates.  At the same time, the loans have been a benefit to her business.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city with beautiful scenery and, since December 1999, a World Heritage site for culture.

Señora Blanca is 34 years old.  She is divorced, but from her marriage has two children, ages 2 and 17.  Her oldest child is studying in a high school in the city.  She doesn’t own her home; the house where she lives is rented.

Doña Blanca is an artisan crafts vendor.  In particular, she sells straw hats.  She sells these products every day of the week without a fixed schedule.  The money from this loan is to buy straw hats to continue to expand her business.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy straw hats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mobile phones and accessories to sell

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is a 43-years-old widow, from a village called Chumlaki. She lives with her two sons and daughter-in-law. The family has a seasonal agricultural business. Particularly, they breed sheep, and after the sheep are grown they are sold in the local market at a good price. Lamzira and her son work at a local wine company and are paid approximately 250-300 GEL monthly. 

The borrower has great desire to move forward and secure her family a better lifestyle, which is why she wants to start her own business. With the requested money she will purchase stock of clothing in the capital city and will then sell the clothing at an increased price locally, at the wine company and among her fellow villagers. Lamzira will be very grateful for lenders helping her generate more income and create financial stability.

loans.use: To start a clothes-trading business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her beauty salon business and earn a higher income.

Beside the salon business, Grace operates a primary school.

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase desks and stationary for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase desks and stationary for her business.

loans.name: David Arturo

texts.es:
David, con 51 años de edad, es un hombre luchador y pujante, que ha sabido sobrepasar las adversidades de la vida. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, un taller de reparación y modificaciones de calzado, el oficio lo aprendió realizando cursos de capacitación en una entidad educativa gratuita, así ha logrado generar ingresos para solventar los gastos personales.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una estantería, uniforme de trabajo y realizar mejoras locativas, esto le permitirá adecuar el espacio de trabajo, mejorando las condiciones para desempeñarlo de manera más eficiente y organizada, esto le ayudará a fidelizar sus clientes y mejorar los ingresos para seguir solventando los gastos del hogar.
David, a pesar de haber sufrido problemas con el alcohol, logró rehabilitarse desde hace dos años, motivado por las ganas de salir adelante y progresar en su negocio, pues esta labor se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos y es consciente que para darle continuidad se debe esforzar y ser constante, además sueña con mejorar la rentabilidad para estar en la capacidad de ayudar económicamente a las personas más necesitadas de su comunidad, pues se siente feliz al realizar esta labor social.
texts.en:
