David, age 51, is a thriving, persistent man who knows how to overcome life’s difficulties.  For a long time now, he has worked in his own business--a workshop where he repairs and makes alterations on footwear.  He learned this line of work from training courses in a free school.  In this way, he has managed to generate an income to cover his personal expenses.

With a desire to strengthen his business, he is asking for the support of a loan to buy a set of shelves and a work uniform, and to make improvements to his shop.  This will allow him to adapt his workspace, improving the conditions to carry out his work in the most efficient and organized way.  This will help him to build loyalty among his customers and to improve his income, so as to keep covering his household expenses.

In spite of having suffered problems with alcohol, two years ago David managed to rehabilitate himself, motivated by his desire to get ahead and progress in his business.  This work has become his only source of income and he is aware that to make it last he should make an effort and be perseverant.  Additionally, he dreams of improving his profits so that he can financially help the more needy people in his community.  It makes him happy to do that type of social work.

loans.use: to buy a set of shelves and a work uniform, and to make improvements to his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials,

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and has three children who are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanaisha has operated a charcoal sales business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

Mwanaisha plans to use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil and dry pepper to attract more customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Meet Charles, a farmer living in the highlands of Kericho with his wife and 3 children. Charles has practiced farming for 7 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and his retail farming business. Charles enjoys dairy farming but his biggest challenge is insufficient funds to carry out his projects.

Charles chose Juhudi Kilimo because they have low interest rates on their loans. During the training, Charles learned that MFIs give loans to low income earners. This loan will help him educate his children well and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
This is Rajab. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more bales of clothes for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, onions, Maggi cubes, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean, 28 years old, is a Cameroonian. He is married and has two children; the 4-year-old is in primary school while the youngest is one year old. Jean has been in this business for over five years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase his capital by 25 percent.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Hamidakhon

texts.en:
Hamidakhon is 55 years old. She is widow and has two adult children. She sells dried fruits in a local market. Her husband had helped her with managing the business and after his death, Hamidakhon’s business was failing. She started with a loan from IMON and little by little she developed her business. 

Hamidakhon is hardworking woman. She has a good credit story. She tries for the well-being of her family. Hamidakhon is going to repair her house as her house is in a bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy wallpaper and paints for reparing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy materials including wallpaper and paints for repairing her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and paraffin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, a coverstitch machine, a lamp, and supplies such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.en: Dodo is 27 years old and a married woman from village Mtispiri. She lives with her husband and 2 kindergarten-aged children. Dodo and her husband run an agricultural business. They are extensively engaged in cattle and milked-cow breeding and in cultivating nuts and maize. The harvested products are sold locally and the family gets small income from this activity. Dodo's husband also works on timber sales. He gets materials from wood and sells it to local people. Nevertheless, the family needs some investment to make it financially stable with a reasonable monthly income. So Dodo decided to request a loan to start a trading business. With the requested money she will purchase stocks of cheese at wholesale prices and will resell it at the local market at an increased price. With the help of this activity she will deal with financial difficulties more easily. Dodo and her husband await your support.

loans.use: To start trading business with cheese

loans.name: Shanije

texts.en:
Shanije, 35 years old, is married and the mother of three children. She is a seamstress operating from her home and she also works for another company. Shanije makes traditional clothes and is very well known in her area, with many customers. She is a hardworking woman who strives hard to improve her family's living conditions. Shanije has contributed to the family’s income through her business for a very long time and her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant. Shanije has a good reputation for quick results and well-made traditional clothing and dresses. 

Shanije currently has a small sewing machine. She hopes that one day she will be able to expand her business even more and believes that having a big sewing machine will be a key factor in this. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new big sewing machine to improve her business and to enable her to work more quickly and with better quality results. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new big sewing machine to improve her business

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 41-year-old lady and a mother of four children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market. His shop is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell, however he finds it difficult due to lack of funds. This material will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

For the above reason, his wife Samar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery material. Samar is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cloth and embroidery accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to have maintenance done on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Sakeena has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Sakeena's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and can provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Sakeena also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Sakeena is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To make repairs on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en: Antoinette is a Cameroonian aged 46. She is married with five children; the oldest is 18 and in high school, while the youngest is 5 and in primary school. She has been in this business for over 10 years, which makes her very experienced and stable, and her business profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her turnover by 45 percent.

loans.use: to buy material to sew cloth

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 40-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running his own welding shop for the past 35 years. He is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.
 
Shehnaz's husband wants to purchase different kinds of tools, metal sheets, and other welding accessories. But due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these things for his business purpose.
 
To fulfill the business needs of her husband, Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan amount will enable her husband to buy the relevant items for his business purpose.

For this financial assistance, Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of tools and welding accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Raila

texts.en:
Raila is a 47-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and manages the entire household. One of her sons has been running his own business of cosmetics sales and supply for the past fifteen years.

Raila's son needs to buy different kinds of cosmetics and other relevant items for reselling purpose, but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these cosmetics. Therefore, Raila has applied for a Kiva loan from it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her son to buy these cosmetics for reselling purpose to earn maximum profitable income. This profitable income will also help him make savings to meet the needs of the family and business.

Raila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics and other items for her son's business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is married with six children. She helps her husband to manage their own farm for a living.  She has been harvesting and selling rice for sixteen years, and it is their main source of income to fulfill their needs. To improve the farm, Julia has taken a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She had to be determined in her efforts to gain an adequate living. She hopes to live comfortably and gain a greater income for their future needs.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en: Rafaela is single and she works hard to support her family. For the past 3 years, she has operated a general store business in the Philippines. Rafaela has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store. In the future, Rafaela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Janet is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, soap, sugar and kerosene for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, soap, sugar and kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida, 41 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband has been working as a driver in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs. Sajida provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute, with her husband, to manage the household. 

Sajida needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business but, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and it will also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different accessories for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business;

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis Décembre 2009 et est constitué de cinq membres qui sont tous issus de la même localité et leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Ramatoulaye debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée et âgée de 40 ans. Elle développe une plantation de bananes.

Avec son crédit elle compte investir dans sa plantation de bananes un montant de 400000f.

Avec son bénéfice, elle désire augmenter son épargne et assurer les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group was created in December 2009 and consists of five members, all of whom are from the same village where they run small businesses. Ramatoulaye is the group's representative. She is standing to the far right of the photo with her arm raised. She is 40 years old, married and working to develop a banana plantation. With this loan she plans to invest in her banana plantation. The resulting earnings will help her increase her savings and provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bananas

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
La socia Vanesa se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza y lenceria para damas,la socia lleva a sus amigos y publico en general,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza y lenceria.La socia solicita le credito para comprar lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vanesa continues to work in her business selling beauty products and women's lingerie. She sells to her friends and to the public in general. She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a business property where she can sell beauty products and lingerie. She is applying for a loan to buy lipstick, creams, and perfume.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, creams, and perfume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more flour, baking powder, yeast, oil, sugar, charcoal, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and feed.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en:
Mukhtaran is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Mukhtaran runs a small boutique at home. She sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it and then sells it at a higher price in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for her cloth garments has increased due to attractive designs and colours. Her husband affords all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 

Mukhtaran wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis, which is the reason she has requested a loan so that she can buy a greater variety of cloth to fulfill the demand. Mukhtaran wishes for a bright future for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sew for resale.

loans.name: Aashi

texts.en:
Aashi is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She does embroidery work by hand at home and financially supports her family. She belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. Aashi learned this art in her childhood and adopted it for her occupation. The work enabled her to become independent and earn sufficient income. 

Aaahi requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase stocks of threads, silk, sequins, and pearls of various colours. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry bush meat, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, coal, sugar, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en: Mahfirat is a repeated client of IMON. She has a good credit history. Mahfirat used her previous loans for developing her business. She is a hardworking and successful business woman. Mahfirat sews and sells men's national clothes ‘chapan’. Mahfirat has been busy with this activity for more than 31 years. She sews ‘chapan’ with high quality. That’s why she has her own regular customers. She earns a living this way. Mahfirat lives with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a master at car repair. Mahfirat is going to buy new washing machine because her washing machine is broken. She is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni to buy a washing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for her household

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a vendor in her village. Though she did not finish her education, she still helps her parents through her business. She sells fruits and vegetables to the people of her village. She also raise hogs for additional income. 

Mylene wanted to keep improving her sales but had insufficient funds to buy more bananas, cabbage, eggplant and squash to sell. For this reason, she is borrowing PHP 13,000. This loan will help her business and income to grow.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, cabbage, eggplant and squash to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer living in the rich highlands of Kericho. He is married and has four children, all of school-going age. He has been doing farming for 30 years, with his income coming from the sale of milk, eggs, tea and crops. He enjoys farming because he gets a lot of yield through it. His challenge is insufficient funds for his farm projects.

Joseph chose Juhudi Kilimo because it bears low interest on its loans. During the training, he learned how to develop a saving culture. This loan will enable him to educate his children and also to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old, married, and has four adult children. She is involved in hog-raising business to help her husband generate income. They reside in a rural community and make their living through farming. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve and strengthen the business in order to earn a higher income. 

Having inadequate capital, Mary requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional piglets, hog feeds, and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so she is able to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase  additional piglets, hog feeds, and vitamins for her hogs
